loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi is 35 years old and lives in the village of Cabisera 9-11 of Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Jimmy who works as a furniture laborer in their village. Their eldest child is Leggie Boy, who is 17 years old. He did not pursue continuing his studies in college because he was not at all interested. Their youngest child is Gelvin, who is 16 years old and presently studying in high school. Levi wants both of them to finish their studies in college. She is trying to convince her eldest son to pursue his studies and she hopes that someday they will both have a complete education.

Levi is requesting a loan amounting to PHP11,000 to use as additional business capital in her tailoring business. She wants her business to expand and become more productive, in order to improve their standard of living. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved so that she can generate more income. That would greatly benefit the education of her children.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Modong

texts.en:
Modong R. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables and tomatoes and is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell.  Modong is 48 years old and is a widow.  She has four children all of whom go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 38 years old.  She is managing a direct selling business and at the same time, does vending of different items such as vegetables, food snacks and so on.  For 19 years being involved in the business, Genalyn was able to finance her family and sends her children to school with her weekly average income of only PHP1, 000. 

She always plans to expand her business, but difficulties of life and lack of financial capital hinders her business plans.  But Genalyn remains strong and determined to work hard for her family, and to have a productive business. She is now requesting to avail the amount of PHP12, 000 that will be added in her business capital for her vending and direct selling.  
	
She is married to Leonardo Sr., a security guard, they have one daughter and she is already in her fourth year high school. They peacefully live at Barangay Namnama Cabatuan, Isabela, it is a rural and plain area. Their house is located at the back of their community center. She kept on working so hard, for the better future of her family.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 59 years old. She is a simple woman who resides in the village of Punit Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is married to Cerilo, a tricycle driver. They have seven children, six of whom are already married and are now living separately from their parents. Dominga has always wanted to have a good standard of living in which they would not suffer from hunger. 

Dominga is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 for the maintenance of their passenger tricycle. The loan will be used to purchase spare parts for their motorcycle that needs to be maintained and repaired. It is the only source of income they have had for five years, and with its aid they are able to provide their basic daily needs. Dominga hopes that her loan will be granted for the continuous operation of their business in order to survive the difficulties of life.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to maintain and repair the motorcycle

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephina is a member of the Idope borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 25, 20, 16 years old. She also cares for other 3 dependents.

Josephina has owned a  business selling maize for 3 years, she works 12 hours  a day and she earns a monthly profits approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Josephina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzanian, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Josephina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ore maize for sale

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is engaged in vending cooked foods in their village. She has been cooking different viands for three years and she sells them in their whole village as her source of income.  Aside from her retail business, Melita is also raising hogs at their backyard.  She is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP18, 000 for the maintenance and improvement of her businesses. Through the loan, she knows that her business will continuously grow. Improvement in her business had seen already and it is because of her hard work and help of lenders who used to support her. 

Melita is now 38 years old and she is married to Mario, a driver for seven years in Manila. She is hoping that their diligence in work will contribute to the success of their children. She hopes that her children will always be eager to finish their studies for their own sake in the future. The couple has five children, four of them are still studying. Their eldest has now married after his graduation in high school. Charlene, their second child, is now in her last year in high school. John Mar, their third child, a second year high school student, John Martin is eight years old and Shaira is four, they are also both studying. Melita is very much thankful for the chance in knowing about KIVA.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Nyume

texts.en:
Nyume J. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and rice to sell as well. Nyume is 30 years old and married to a husband who is a peasant. She has four children and they all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has been dreaming to uplift their ways of living. She is now 32 years old and she believes that life is too short; she hopes that before God take back her life, she already secure a good life for her children.  Her two children are both studying in the primary school and her husband is out of the country working as a driver in Saudi Arabia. There is nothing more she could asked for than to see her family moved out from poor living condition. She hopes that someday, her family will be together again living a comfortable life. 

Mary Jane is now managing her own general store which is located in their village at Cabisera 9 -11 Ilagan, Isabela. She started her business just before her husband left to work. She would like to expand her business that is why, she wanted to request for additional business capital amounting to PHP5, 000. She hopes that her loan will be provided because she needed to have additional working capital to grow up her business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Marie Egidia

texts.en:
Egidia K. is 40 years old, married and has 6 children aged between 18 and 5 years old. Egidia has been in a business of a restaurant for 7 years and she employs 6 people in her restaurant working from 7h00 A.M to 9h00 P.M

After realizing that her investment is too low to get more profit, Egidia is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company s.a   for expanding her restaurant qualitatively and quantitatively. 

By receiving and using this loan, Egidia hopes to get more profit then with that profit, she hopes to help her husband to buy a house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: For purchasing more foodstuff

loans.name: Ana May

texts.en:
Ana May is 45 years old from the village of Roxas Naguilian, Isabela.  She is already a widow for 19 years and left with their only son who is now 21 years old. Her son did not finish his education due to early marriage.  She hopes that they’ll always be together for they are the only family left with her.

Ana May has been five years managing her retail business. She has a small variety store in their village and this serves as their sole source of income. The income she derives from her business is being used to support herself necessities and other needs of her grandchild. She hopes to maintain the business she has to able survives from life’s difficulties. Ana May  therefore wanted to request to avail a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 to be use as her additional working capital to grow her business. She is hoping that her proposal will be approved because it will quite be helpful to her family.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Ndolo

texts.en:
Ndolo M. is 36 years old and married to Mary Ndolo. Together they have three children who all go to school. Ndolo has been running a posho mill business for the last three years in Naivasha town. (A posho mill is a hammer mill that grinds maize into corn flour, which is then cooked and served as "ugali", a staple in Kenya.)

He joined KADET through a friend who is already a client. This is Ndolo's third loan with KADET. He used his first loan to buy a posho mill, and with his second loan he serviced the machine.

He now intends use this third loan to increase his stock by buying more maize, as this will enable him to increase his income and serve his loyal clientele better.   

Ndolo hopes his business grows and that he will be able to open a chain of posho mills outside Naivasha.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering their clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy maize stock

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: A. Béatrice est née le 14/04/1959 à SEGBOHOUE. Béatrice est mariée à LOKOSSOU Rigobert, un peintre. Ce couple a à sa charge sept enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis vingt deux ans à Fridjrossè, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Béatrice vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Béatrice mène comme activité la vente de condiments de sauce, les céréales et le charbon de bois. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Béatrice achète ses produits et elle les vend chez elle à la maison. Béatrice a déjà quinze d’expérience dans cette activité. Béatrice a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Béatrice demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs, de charbon de bois et des condiments de sauce.

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu A. is currently in the business of selling clothes at the nearby market and is requesting a loan to purchase shoes to sell. Dudu is 38 years old and is widowed. She has 4 children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open another selling point in another area.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephina is a member of the Idope borrower group in Kinayanambo, Iringa. She  is married and a mother of 4 children. He children are 23, 21, 18, 15 years old.

Josephina has owned a business for 5 years, she works 8 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Josephina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for making local beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Josephina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for local beer

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 34 years old and living a simple life in the village of Cabisera 9-11 Ilagan, Isabela. She is single and lives with her parents. Mylene hopes to lift up their lives from their poor living conditions. She dreams of operatinga more stable business someday.

Mylene has been in the food retailing business for 20 years. She sells different products such as fish, meat, and vegetables in her village. Thanks to her patience and experience in vending, she is presently earning a net income of PHP 200 daily.

Growing her business is the main reason why Mylene wanted to take out a loan in the amount of PHP 4,000 from Kiva lenders. She hopes that she will be given the chance to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve and expand her food retailing business

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a very responsible husband and father.  He is 40years old and he is married to Myrna, 38 years old. They are blessed with two children: Melowin, 18 years old, a first year college student and Eron, four years old, already studying in a Day Care Center in their village.  Wilson is doing her best to provide the needs of his family and one of his goals is to send their children to school.  

Wilson has been managing a store and a bakeshop in their village. He has been in this kind of business for already two years and he always wanted to further grow his business, however, availability of sufficient capital hinders him. He hopes to avail a loan amounting to PHP7, 000 to be used as his additional working capital for his retail business. The loan will be of big help for the progress of his business so he prays that lenders will give him the opportunity of improving his general store and bakeshop

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley T. is from the village of Landing, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Shirley is separated from her spouse and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Shirley owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Shirley is just starting this business.

In 2009, Shirley joined HSPFI. Her goal was to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Shirley is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, an amount that will be used to purchase new items in order to expand the store's product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Shirley from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the store's product offerings

loans.name: Isabelo

texts.en:
Isabelo is 49 years old. He is a simple businessman residing in Cabisera 9-11 Ilagan, Isabela. He is married to Rusia and they are managing their farming business.  Aside from farming, Isabelo is also engaged in the retailing business of generic medicines which he started since 1981. He usually sells his products using his motorcycle as a service. He patiently roam to different villages to sell his products.  

Isabelo is requesting a loan amounting to PHP6, 000 for the growth of his business. He will use it as additional capital in purchasing more medicines to sell. He knows that his business will become more profitable if it will be supported by the KIVA lenders.  He hopes to maintain it and further expand as it is continuously sustained through the years.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Kojoki

texts.en: Kojoki B. is currently in the business of selling at the shop and is requesting a loan to purchase and stock more items in her shop to sell.  Kojoki is 38 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase and stock more items in her shop to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is already 43 years old and she is married to Nestor, a farmer.  They have four children and two of them are still studying. The two eldest children just finished their secondary education and now helping their father in the farm. Their family lives peacefully in the village of Punit, Benito Soliven, Isabela.

Yolanda has been into retailing their produced vegetable products in San Mariano Public Market for already five years. Sometimes, Yolanda also buys her neighbors produce vegetables in their farm and gardens and will later sell at a higher price to earn income. She is hoping to acquire additional revolving capital for the growth of her vending business. She could buy more vegetables with more capital thus will increase her income. If given the chance to avail a loan, she will also use it in purchasing vegetable seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable garden. Yolanda therefore is asking for financial amount of PHP4, 000 for further development of her vending business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Stellamaris Syombua

texts.en:
Stellamaris and her husband Shadrack have three daughters: Faith (six years old), Dorcas (four years old), and Esther (two years old). Stellamaris has been operating a butcher shop for four years. Her area of business is in a highly populated area within eastlands Nairobi. Her target clients are the families living within the area. She also supplies meat to a number of hotels.

Stellamaris was introduced to KADET by existing clients and she has no previous credit history. She would like to use the loan proceeds to renovate her butcher shop by repainting it. With the extra profits she expects to gain, shet plans to open another butchery.

Stellamaris aspires to own a chain of butcheries since she believes she is hardworking and honest enough to bring her goals to reality.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs across Kenya and their children. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: Renovating the butchery premise by repainting it.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy L. is from the village of Sta Cruz,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Joy is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Joy owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized "sari-sari" retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste etc.in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Joy is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Joy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jenielyn

texts.en: Jenielyn N. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Jenielyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling used clothing known as ukay-ukay in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Jenielyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
Cristeta is already a widow.  She and her children are living in Barangay Malamag West of Tumauini, Isabela.  Her five children are now married and they live with their own families. Cristeta is now sending her youngest in a secondary level of education and she is hoping that he will finish his education someday. 

To make a living, Cristeta is selling pork and carabao meat in their village. She is now five years in the business and she is hoping to grow it more for her generate bigger income. Aside from the meat that she sells, she also sells cooked foods and other additional products to sell in her vending stall to increase her income. Cristeta is hoping to avail an additional working capital to improve her business further and able gain more income. She is requesting to borrow the amount of PHP5, 000.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: A. Charlotte est née vers 1979 à Abomey. Charlotte est mariée à KPATINDE Armel,  un conducteur de taxi. Ce couple a à sa charge quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis dix sept ans à Fridjrossè kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C’est le mari de Charlotte qui assure les charges de la famille. C’est la peau de bœufs que Charlotte vend. C’est à Zongo et à Abattoir où on vend les bœufs que Charlotte achète ses produits et elle les vend au marché d’Adjaha. Charlotte a déjà quinze d’expérience dans cette activité. Charlotte a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Charlotte demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de peau de bœufs.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita manages a jewelry business four years. She is procuring silver jewelries from a jewelry shop in Cauayan and Bangkok gold from one of her friends. She is selling them directly to her friends and some customers in their village. Marita is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 from the KIVA lenders to have additional working capital for the expansion of her business. She hopes that it will be granted to maintain her business which is very helpful in sending her children to school. 

Marita is appointed as treasurer in their village for already two years. She is married to Ruben and he is working as a tricycle operator. They have four children whom two are still studying.  She hopes that through her business and her husband’s transportation daily income, they could generate enough income to be used in sending their children in school. She hopes that KIVA lenders could help their business grow and be capable of helping their children in completing their education.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Ancille

texts.en:
Ancilla U. is 38 years old ,married with 6 children aged between 6 and 15 years old.
She lives in Rubavu District , west  province of Rwanda where she sells the fishes for  fives years. She starts her business everyday from 7h00 AM to 5h00 PM,and employs one person in her business.

Before this business she was a fermer where she could not get all needs for her family.
With this new loan she plans to purchase more fishes so that she gets more profit .
With extra profit ancille will be able  to save money,to get more food for her family, to pay school fees for her children and expand her business

loans.use: for purchasing more fishes

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie has a hog raising business and has been involved with a retailing business for the past two years. Lenie is 31 years old and she is married to Edwin, a farmer. They are blessed with three children who are all in school. Their eldest is Keneth – 11 years old, followed by Godly – six years old and Mark Anthony – one year old. The family lives peacefully in the village of Malamag West, Tumauini, Isabela.

Lenie manages both her businesses to garner income for the welfare of her family. She wants to further expand her businesses and has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP. She hopes to have a full line of commodities in her store for more profit and to have a supply of hog feed for the growth and maintenance of her hog raising business. With the help of this loan, Lenie knows that everything will go better with her businesses.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina manages her own general store business which is located just in front of their house. At the age of 54, she still accepts laundry for additional income.  to meet the needs of their family.  Marina’s business is not continuously operated due shortage of revolving capital. Thus, she opted to request a loan of at least PHP5, 000 from KIVA lenders to use as her additional revolving capital towards further development of her store. 

Marina is residing at the village of Roxas Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Romeo, a farmer in their village.  They have three children: Richard, Ronnie and Romel. Richard and Ronnie are already married.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn D.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 20 years old and single, living in the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. Marilyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This will be Marilyn's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 34 years old and is residing with her family in the village of Malamag West Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Joey who is 32 years old. They own a farm and her husband is the one working on it. They have three kids and all of them are currently studying in the primary school. According to Marites, she will do her best to grow her business to able provide sufficient needs to her children especially when it comes to their education.

Marites has been three years managing her own variety store in their village. She always aspires to be more competent by having more grocery items to retail in her small store. She is hoping to avail a loan of PHP3, 000 to have additional working capital to further improve her business. She hopes that her loan will be approved because it will help her business grow further and for the education of her children.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a responsible mother to her four children. She is married to Santiago, a farmer. Their eldest son, Florentino, is 22 years old. He graduated from college and is now working as a dental technician in Manila. Their second child, Harold, age 19, is currently studying to be a dental technician in Manila. Next is Myrna, age 16 and Epifanio, age 12, both of whom are studying in high school. Lina hopes that all her children finish their studies because she believes that their achievements in life are also achievements for their parents who supported them all the way.  

Lina is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 from Kiva. She will use the loan to improve her rice business. She sells rice and vegetables three times a week in the market. When not in the market, she tries to sell her vegetables in their village through house-to-house vending. She hopes that, with patience, she can send all her children to college and attain their dream, which is to finish their studies and look for jobs. She is glad that her husband also works hard as a farmer. They strive to give their children a bright future.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.en:
Pascuala is already 60 years old and is married to Cornelio, who is busy working in their small farm lot located in their village. They are blessed with six children and they are married. They now have their own families and lives separately from them. Pascuala and her husband are happily residing in the village of Malamag West Tumauini, Isabela.

Pascuala has been managing her general store since her children were still young. It serves as their alternative source of income for how many years and was of big help to their family. Pascuala is still aiming to become progressive in her retail business. Having sufficient capital, she knows that her ambition will be attained. That is why she wanted to request loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 as additional business capital that will somehow lead to the progress of her general store.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Florentine

texts.fr: A. Florentine est née le 01/01/1985 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Florentine est mariée à SESSOUKPE Daniel, un cuisinier. Ce couple a à sa charge cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont trois sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis huit ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C’est le mari de Florentine qui assure les charges de la famille. Florentine mène comme activité la vente de boissons alcoolisées appelées localement SODABI, produit au Bénin. C’est à Agonli, localité spécialisée dans la production de cette boisson que Florentine achète son produit et elle le vend de façon ambulante. Florentine a déjà huit ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Florentine a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus importante, Florentine sollicite un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
A. Florentine was born on January 1, 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to SESSOUKPE Daniel, a cook. This couple has five children to support. Three of them are their own; they are all in school. For eight years, the family has been residing in Fridjrossè Kpota, a district of Cotonou. Florentine’s husband is the one who ensures that family expenses are met. Florentine runs a business selling the alcoholic drink locally called SODABI, which is produced in Benin. Agonli, a town specialized in producing this drink, is where she purchases her merchandise, which she sells door-to-door. She already has eight years of experience in this business. Florentine has had two loans with ALIDé and has repaid them. She was able to use the loans to raise her level of business. To satisfy further the demands of her expanding customer base, she is requesting a third loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five 50-liter drums of the drink SODABI

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites runs a manicure and pedicure business. She also manages a small variety store for additional income. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5000 from Kiva. Marites works diligently so she can send her children to college. She is hoping to provide them with all their needs so that, some day, there will be greater possibilities for them to uplift themselves and their family.

Marites is a woman who has a strong fighting spirit. She never considers problems to conquer her life because she has a principle that says “If you let your worries conquer you, you will never win.” Marites is 34 years old and is married to Samuel L., who carves wood and assembles simple furniture that they purchase in their village.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 36 years old and is already a widow. She is blessed with four children who are presently studying with the help of her retailing business. She is the only one providing the needs of her children, thus she must work really hard.  Their education is very important thus trying to give it to them with the best of her ability. She lives together with her children in the village of Malamag West Ilagan, Isabela.

Josefa wanted to request for a loan amounting to pHP20, 000 from the KIVA lenders. This amount will be of great help in expanding her general store business. She hopes that it will continuously expand so that she will be able to send her children to school and see them finish their studies. She is doing her best to fulfill her dreams for her business and for her family.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is managing a hog raising business. She enjoys her business and she hopes to maintain it with the help of the KIVA lenders. She is asking for their financial support to purchase stocks of feeds and additional piglets to be raised. She would like to borrow a loan of at least PHP5, 000 and she hopes that her loan will be approved so that she will have additional working capital for the maintenance and growth of her business. 

Francisca is a resident from Barangay Malamag West Tumauini, Isabela. She have three children with her loving husband Gilbert who is working as a laborer and at the same time a farmer. Their eldest is a college undergraduate and their second child has just finished her secondary level of education and had stopped studying already. Their youngest is already on his third year high school.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 55 years old. She is from the village of Malamag West Tumauini, Isabela. She has four children, three of whom are married. Her youngest child is still studying and she hopes that her child will finish her studies. She is married to Sixto, who is a 59-year-old farmer.

Adelaida sells vegetables and food snacks in their village. She also sells peanuts that they harvest from their farm.  She goes house-to-house to reach people in their community. She patiently sells her products to earn income for their family. Her income is very helpful to their family and she hopes that it will survive and grow continuously to provide sufficient needs to their children. 

Adelaida is requesting a loan of PHP 3,000 to as additional working capital to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick W. is 40 years old and married with three children. He has a poultry farm where he incubates chicks then sells to customers from the outskirts of Kinoo center, which is highly populated. He has never borrowed from another MFI and was introduced to KADET by a friend. He has applied for a loan which he wants to use to acquire incubators that will hold up to 1000 chicks at a time. He hopes to be a major supplier of chicks in the area and also to other big poultry firms.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To buy more chick incubators

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
Nely renders services like pedicure and manicure in their village. According to her, she just started selling barbecue stick, balot and native cakes in the afternoon for her to have additional income.  She hopes to maintain and grow her business by availing an additional working capital of at least PHP4, 000. She really hopes to avail the loan to have sufficient revolving capital for her businesses. This will help her in supplementing the educational needs of her children. 

Nely have four children whom two are presently studying. Her eldest child will pursue her education in college next school year and she’s preparing for that time to come. Her husband is a carpenter and he is currently working in Manila, a place away from them. This is the only way they know to provide their family with sufficient support.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene P. is from the village of Lower Balulang in Cagayan de Oro City. She is 21 years old. Airene is married and has 2 young children. To make a living, Airene owns and operates a clothing business where she sells used clothing known as "ukay ukay" to local community members. Airene is just starting this business.

In 2009, Airene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Airene is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Airene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria manages a general store in her village. She also sells rice, which has been a great help in making her business profitable. Maria would like to ask for financial assistance from Kiva lenders to help her expand her business. She has lots of dreams and one is to make progress in her business. Maria is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to be used as additional working capital.
 
Maria is 62 years old and lives in Malamag West Tumauini, Isabela. She have two children, Jemma and Donna. Jemma is a 27-year-old college graduate who works as a teacher in Tumauini. Donna is 23 years old. She also graduated from college and is currently looking for a job. Now that her children are done with their education, Maria is aiming to elevate their standard of living with the help of her business income. She hopes that the loan request will be granted because it will help her attain her dreams for her family.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Renea

texts.en:
Renea V. is a 34 year-old married woman with 3 young children. Her youngest child is only 5 months old and the oldest is just 9. She is married to John V. and the family lives in the village of Purok Paraiso, Brgy. Abuanan, Bago City, Negros Occidental. Renea aspires to help her husband increase their family income enough to sustain the needs of her children and provide for their future security.

Renea is always looking for opportunities to provide her family with an additional source of income. First, she started a business selling a variety of native delicacies at the local school. As her small business prospered, she needed more capital to meet her customer's demands. This made her decide to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000, which provided access to more capital for her business expansion. By her 3rd loan cycle, she already had some savings and was able to open a general store where she sells ready-to-wear clothes. 

The new ventures were quite successful from the start and her husband encouraged her to put her skills into other possibilities. He suggested that they buy a sow so that they could start raising pigs in their backyard. This turned out to be a wise decision.

For her previous loan, she borrowed PHP 15,000 to invest in her various business ventures, including hog-raising. She was able to repay her loan on time without any delays in the weekly installments. Now that she is borrowing her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she intends to borrow PHP 16,000 so that she can buy another sow and expand her general store,  which is adjacent to her house.


About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additonal stocks for general store and to buy another sow

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher N. is a 25-year-old father of two children, an 8-year-old and a 7-month-old. He is married to Priscilla Wambui. 

Christopher has been a motorbike taxi driver for five years. He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is Christopher’s first loan from KADET. He has never before borrowed from any microfinance institution. Christopher will use this loan to service his motorbike.

In the future, he hopes to own a chain of taxi vehicles.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Servicing his motorbike

loans.name: Federico

texts.en: Federico T. tills a hectare of rice farm, which was pawned to him. He is 49 years old, married and has one child who is now 20 years old. Federico is now on his fourth cycle in CEV. According to him, he was able to pay for his loans because of the low interest rate. Now he is requesting for a loan of Php10, 000. He will use the loan for farm inputs and also to pay for the laborers on the farm. This loan will surely help Federico sustain the farm he is tilling.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry S. is a rice farmer from Trento, Agusan Del Sur. He is 43 years old, married, and has five children. Currently, he tills a 2-hectare (~5-acre) rice field. 

This is Jerry's fourth loan from CEV. He believes that the biblical reflection during CEC cluster meetings really helped him and his fellow members.

Jerry is now requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to finance his farm. The loan will also be used to pay for farm laborers.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Warly

texts.en: Failure was not absent in Warly D. P.’s life but he is eager to go on and nowhere near quitting. Warly, a 35-year-old married man with two children, is a rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur. He is cultivating a three-hectare rice field, where main income of his family comes from. In lack of farm inputs, Warly is requesting for a loan of Php10, 000. This will help Warly in maintaining the farm he is tending and also pay for the laborers.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Mrs. Marissa E. is a 45-year-old married woman who is blessed with four children. She has made her living by growing rice for almost 3 decades. As a tenant farmer of a 2-hectare (~5-acre) rice field, she has to work hard to produce a rich harvest and earn a good income. 

Marissa is a member of CEV and is now on her 4th loan cycle. She especially likes the monthly amortization for agriculture and the biblical reflections during meetings. 

Marissa is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase farm supplies. This loan will surely help Marissa to improve the farm that she tends.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma D. is a tenant farmer for a 4-hectare (~10-acre) rice field in Agusan Del Sur. She is 39 years old, married and has 6 children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

This is Elma's 4th loan from CEV. She likes the program and is thankful because the loan is amortized monthly, so she can save the money that she needs to repay her loan. 

Now, she is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to buy farm supplies and pay for farm laborers.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Ma. Jenalyn

texts.en: Ma. Jenalyn T. is a hard-working mother. She lives with her husband and their five children in their home in Agusan Del Sur. She cultivates a two and a half hectare of rice farm. To satisfy her family’s needs, she makes extra effort in farming to have good income. Jenalyn requested for a loan of Php10, 000, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and to pay the laborers who help her till the farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn U. is from the village of Lower Balulang. She is 29 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 2 young children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a  sari-sari (variety) store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of PHP 5000 which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is blessed to own a hectare (2.5 acre)  rice farm. She lives with her huslband of twenty-five years and their five children. Rosemarie makes an extra effort to cultivate their farmland. She wants to make sure her crops are healthy and produce a good harvest. Thankful for the low interest rate at CEV, she maintained her membership and is now on her 4th loan cycle. 

She has requested a loan of Php 10,000 for farm supplies. This loan will help Rosemarie in her farming business.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: B. Monique est née le 01/01/1981 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Monique est mariée à AHOTON Emile, un électricien. Ce couple a à sa charge quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis cinq ans à Sènadé 2, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C’est le mari de Monique qui assure les charges de la famille. Ceci permet à Monique d’utiliser les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. Monique mène comme activité la vente de tissus, mèches et tissages pour la coiffure, les sacs de sortie, etc.  C’est à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin que Monique achète ses produits. Monique vend ses produits sur commande et à crédit. Monique a déjà neuf ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Monique a déjà eu cinq crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Monique demande un sixième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin d’accroitre le volume de son activité.
texts.en:
B. Monique was born on January 1, 1981 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to AHOTON Emile, an electrician. This couple has four children to support. Two of them are their own; they are all in school. For five years, the family has been residing in Sènadé 2, a district of Cotonou. Monique’s husband is the one who ensure that family expenses are met. This allows Monique to use the revenues from her business to develop it further. She works at selling cloth, hair extensions and weaves for hairdressing, handbags, etc. Lomé, Togo, the capital of a neighboring country, is where Monique buys her products. Monique sells her products by special order and on credit. She already has nine years of experience in this business. She had five ALIDé loans that she has repaid. She was able to use the loans to raiser her level of business. To continuer to develop her business, she’s asking for a sixth loan to bolster her working capital, so as to increase her business volume.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags, and cloth

loans.name: Noli

texts.en: Corn and rubber trees comprise Noli’s farm in his hometown of Agusan Del Sur. Married and with four children, he works hard to provide for his family. He is a member of CEV and is now on 4th loan. He especially likes their savings policy because it is really helpful in times of need. He has requested a loan of  Php 10,000 to increase his working capital. He hopes to grow his farm immensely.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr: C. Virginie est née vers 1953 à Allada. Virginie veuve. Virginie a à sa charge cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre sont les tiens. Virginie réside depuis onze  ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Virginie les charges de sa famille. C’est des boissons liqueurs que Virginie vend. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Béatrice et à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin que Virginie achète ses produits et elle va à Comè, dans le Département du Mono pour les vendre. Virginie a déjà neuf ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Virginie a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Virginie demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de cartons de boissons liqueurs.

loans.name: Regine

texts.en:
Regine M. is 56 years old, is married with five children aged between 28 and 12, and she takes care of seven dependents.

Regine has been selling clothes for the past thirteen years. She employs one person, working from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Regine is now requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company to expand her business through purchasing more clothes to sell.

Through accessing this new loan, Regine hopes to earn more profit than before. Then, with that profit, she will be able to get more food for her family and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en:
Livingstone K. is 52 years old and married with one child. He owns a piece of land where he plants seedlings for sale to other farmers. He has been in the business for the past 35 years and he approximates his monthly profit to about kshs 43,000.  

He has not borrowed from another MFI and was introduced to KADET by a friend. He has applied for a loan which he wants to use to buy manure for his farm to improve production.

He hopes to have different kinds of seedlings so as to have more supplies for his customers.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buying manure

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph M. is a 33-year-old married businessman. He supplies different commodities, such as milk, bread and cakes, to his customers using his bicycle. He has been running this business for about six years now with a monthly profit of Ksh 20,000. 

Joseph has not previously borrowed from any another MFI. He was introduced to KADET by a friend. He has applied for a loan which he plans to use to buy three more bicycles and also employ some staff who will help in supplying goods to other markets. Joseph hopes to own a bakery by acquiring more loans from KADET.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To buy three more bicycles

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios C. is a 65-year-old widow who has six adult children, five of whom already have their own families. Only Mila, her youngest daughter who has special needs, lives at home. Remedios lives in the village of Serena, Brgy. Enclaro, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. The death of her husband left her bereft, especially as she has to take care of her youngest, who has disabilities. Her business activities actually help her to slowly forget her grief and move on. Having a child who totally depends on her gives her a reason and motivates her to continue with her business.

Remedios has a general store which she sustains through her loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon. This has been her source of income for the past 15 years and it provides her with a net profit of 8,000 Philippine pesos a month, enough to cover her small household's expenses and allow her to save enough to buy appliances, renovate her house and also invest in a frozen-foods business. She is very thankful for the help of NWTF-Project Dungganon because her five children were able to finish their academic education and because it continues to help her be independent and support her special child.

She just paid off her 13th loan cycle of Php 19,500 without any delays in the weekly installment. For her 14th cycle, she is borrowing Php 19,500 to continue the sustainability of her general store. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Léontine

texts.fr: D. Léontine est née vers 1958 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Léontine est mariée à LAOUTO Joseph, un cuisinier. Ce couple a à sa charge quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis dix huit ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Léontine vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Léontine vend des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique, des tisanes et des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Léontine achète ses produits et elle les vend chez elle à la maison. Léontine a déjà vingt huit d’expérience dans cette activité. Léontine a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Léontine demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat des ustensiles de cuisines en plastique, de divers et des tisanes.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar is married with five children, two of whom are working. In addition, her husband works as a daily worker in Israel.

Kawthar is one of FATEN’s oldest clients. She has received several loans, starting with 200 USD, and repaid them all in full and on time.

Kawthar started selling clothes out of her house but, for six months, she has rented a store in the camp center. She wants the loan to buy more clothes to meet the demands of her clients, especially since these days are the peak for such products.

Kawthar appears in the photo at her store.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for her store

loans.name: Ida

texts.fr: D. Ida est née le 14/04/1980 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Ida est mariée à AGBOTA Fidèle. Ce couple a à sa charge cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont trois sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis vingt sept ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Ida vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Ida vend à manger de façon ambulante. C’est la pâte rouge de maïs et le riz que Ida vend. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Ida achète ses provisions. Ida a déjà cinq ans  d’expérience dans cette activité. Ida a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Ida demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs et de riz ainsi que la viande, le poisson, les condiments et l’huile.

loans.name: Jeanne's Group

texts.fr: D. Jeanne est née le 01/01/1958 à Grand-Popo. Jeanne est mariée à SOUKOU Martin, un tailleur. Ce couple a à sa charge six enfants dont quatre sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis vingt deux ans à Fridjrossè, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Jeanne vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Jeanne vend de façon ambulante des tissus. Mais, Jeanne vend aussi du SODABI, une boisson alcoolisée produit au Bénin. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Jeanne achète ses produits. Jeanne a déjà dix ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Jeanne a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Jeanne demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
D. Jeanne was born on January 1, 1958 in Grand-Popo. She is married to SOUKOU Martin, a tailor. This couple has six children to support. Four of them are their own. For 22 years, the family has been residing in Fridjrossè, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Thanks to the income from her business, Jeanne comes to her husband’s aid in covering family expenses. She sells cloth door-to-door. But she also sells SODABI, an alcoholic drink produced in Benin. Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where Jeanne buys her products. Jeanne already has ten years of experience in this business. She had two loans with ALIDé that she has repaid. She was able to use the loans to raise her level of business. To continue to develop it, she’s asking for a third loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and drums of the drink SODABI

loans.name: Raufboy

texts.en:
Raufboy A. is a married father of three children. He is a farmer, and in spite of his youth he supports his family with hard work and dedication. He is always in the fields growing grapes, leaving early in the morning to water the fields and then fertilize and fumigate the crops. This work is satisfying, and it enables him to purchase goods for his home. Raufboy would like to request a loan of 7000 Somoni which he can use to buy necessary farm inputs like fertilizers since they are very expensive. He is very optimistic that this amount will improve his yield and he hopes to have a continuous partnership with the lenders. Raufboy always makes sure that he respects the people around him since he believes that respect begets respect.     
 
About Tajikistan:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.  But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's history:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Guzal

texts.en:
H. Guzal is 35 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now Guzal dedicates herself to raising and selling the cows and with the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and has become her best friend. She asks for a loan of $1350 USD in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment Guzal will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal.

loans.use: Purchasing the small cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
Mavzuna K. is 25 years old. She runs a beauty salon, providing services such as hair cutting and styling, manicures, and cosmetology.  The salon also rents wedding dresses and national dresses. The salon is rather successful and generates a stable income for the family. Mavzuna would like to purchase new wedding and national dresses for renting and therefore requests a loan of $3000. Mavzuna thanks everyone who supports her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase wedding and national dresses for rental.

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.fr: F. Eugénie est née vers 1957 à Grand-Popo. Eugénie est mariée à EZIN Sébastien, un agent retrait de l’Office des Postes et Télécommunication du Bénin. Ce couple a à sa charge quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis dix sept ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C’est le mari d'Eugénie qui assure les charges de la famille. Eugénie vend de la farine de blé et du sucre en poudre en mesure d’un kilogramme qu’elle attache dans des sachets, de l’huile d’arachide ; elle vend aussi de la bouillie de maïs et des beignets. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Eugénie achète ses produits et elle les vend devant chez elle à la maison. Eugénie a déjà onze ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Eugénie a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Eugénie demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
F. Eugénie was born around 1957 in Grand-Popo.  She is married to EZIN Sébastien, a retired representative of the Office des Postes et Télécommunication du Bénin.  This couple has four children to support.  Two of them are their own; all four are in school.  For 6 or 7 years, the family has been residing in Fridjrossè Kpota, a district of Cotonou.  Eugénie's husband is the one who ensure that family expenses are covered.  Eugénie sells wheat flour and sugar in bags by the kilo;  she also sells peanut oil, cornmeal porridge, and beignets. Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where Eugénie purchases her goods, which she sells in front of her house.  She already has 11 years of experience in this business.  She had two ALIDé loans before that she has repaid.  She was able to use them to raise her level of business.  To continue to develop her business, Eugénie is asking for a third loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and wheat flour

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.en:
Mahliyo O. is a 40-year-old married mother of four who is devoted to her children and struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Thirteen years ago she got the idea to start raising cattle to help contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available at her house. Slowly the number of cattle increased and her clients started asking for more and more.  With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of her animals she raises and for this reason she is requesting a loan of $1350. Thank you for helping Mahliyo grow her business!

About Tajikistan:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.  But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's history:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Zainiddin

texts.en:
S. Zainiddin is 26 years old. He dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a microbus. He has a wife and three children. Zainiddin has about 10 years of experience in the public transportation field, and the competition is rather high in this business since there are so many people who need it. His current request is so that he can maintain his vehicle, since this is the tool of his trade. So now he is counting on your help and requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni for purchasing necessary spare parts for his microbus. With your support, Zainiddin will continue to progress.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new microbus for expanding business

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
S. Fotima is 40 years old. She is married with three children. Fotima has a tailoring business. Her business is sewing national women dresses. Her workmanship is very good and being young she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and with a good head for business. She has had this business for 10 years and gained a lot of experience. With her loan, Fotima will buy automated sewing machine for improving he business. Fotima smiles when asked what her dreams are for the future. She quickly replies that she plans to open a workshop, hire seamstresses and expand her business. With her spirit, she will surely succeed.

loans.name: Agonhoue Lucie

texts.fr: F. Agonhoue Lucie est née le 01/01/1984 à Abomey. Lucie est mariée à EZIN Saturnin, un agent de l’Office des Poste et Télécommunication du Bénin. Ce couple a à sa charge cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis vingt deux ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C’est le mari de Lucie qui assure les charges de la famille. Ceci permet à Lucie d’utiliser les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. Lucie vend des vivres (maïs, mil, sorgho, sucre en poudre, riz, farine de manioc, haricot, huile d’arachide, etc.) et du charbon de bois. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Béatrice achète ses produits. Lucie a déjà sept ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Lucie a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Lucie demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs, de haricot, de riz et de bidons d’huile d’arachide.

loans.name: Luftijon

texts.en:
Luftijon is a married mother of three children determined to provide a better living for her family. For the past 5 years, Luftijon has sold children’s clothing at “Juma-bazar” market in Khujand. She is hardworking and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Luftijon has a strong business base. Currently, she is seeking a loan of $800 to purchase a new vending facility and expand her business. With the increased income, Luftijon plans to continue growing her business and to improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a new vending facility.

loans.name: Winfrida

texts.en:
Winfrida is a member of the Gangilonga borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 1 year old. 

Winfrida has owned a shop business for 3 years, she works 4 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Winfrida`s first loan form BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Winfrida hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira is an enterprising woman who is always happy to do good work. When she was young she had a big desire for self-improvement. She has been in the cattle breeding business for about 10 years. This allows her to support her three children, who are the motivation for all of her hard work. She wants to increase her investment capital to be able to keep supporting them. With your support Shoira will be able to buy new animals and expand her business. Thank you for supporting Shoira.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
Anvar U. is a 47-year-old married father of three children. He has great passion for dairy farming and has been in this business for 21 years together with his wife and eldest son. He would like to expand his business by adding additional cows. This is because he recently acquired orders from outside town to supply milk. Anvar is requesting a loan of $1350 to buy more dairy cows and the necessary feed. With additional income Anvar will be better able to cover his family financial obligations, especially the education of his children.
