What she likes most about her job is that she is able to taste all the delicious flavors of ice cream that she sells. This is her favorite dessert. She has been doing this for fifteen years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting the merchandise, as she only has one means of transportation and she needs another in order to speed up her work. In the future she would like to be able to manufacture her own ice cream treats and not have to buy them in the city. She needs to prepare for this. This is her fourteenth loan through "Microfinanzas PRISMA" and she knows that on-time payments are vital to the development and success of a communal bank. Otilia needs "1,500 PEN" ($525 US) in order to buy a freezer so that she can increase her inventories in order to satisfy her customers' demands, most of which are from schools.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is married to Melecio, a company driver and they were blessed with a three year old daughter and they are living in the village of Malamag West Tumauini, Isabela. Despite the hardships of life, the couple still strives to be successful in their own careers for the benefit of their child. She is glad that there is cooperation in their family and they have a good relationship with each other.

Cristina is a vegetable vendor in their village. She patiently sells them through house to house just to generate income which is being used for their daily needs. Christina is hoping to avail a loan amounting to PHP4, 000 for the growth of her business. She wanted to sell bigger amount of vegetables in order to gain more income to sustain all the growing needs of their child. She hopes that her business will be supported by the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Amilyn

texts.en:
Amilyn A. used to work as a domestic helper in the United Arab Emirates with her dream to provide for the needs of her family, especially for her child.  After finishing her contract, she decided to return to her family for good and start her own business.  Her husband is employed at the  Evergreen Cereal Company as a delivery man. He is working away from them and he only come home every two months.

Amilyn is now engaged in selling processed foods like longganisa, pork tocino, chicken tocino and other frozen foods.  She is also planning to put up a small canteen near the school campus to be able to improve her business and for them to have a stable source of living.  

Amilyn would like a loan amounting to PHP5, 000  to pursue her business plan.  She wants to start managing her school canteen as soon as she has enough working capital.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Celso

texts.en: Celso V. is from the city of Bañadro, Ozamiz City. He is 41 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Celso owns and operates a specialized "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Celso joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his second from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Nem

texts.en: S. is a widow mother of the four children; two of whom are married and live separately and the other two single and work as the garment workers. S. in the age of 56 years old owns a small business selling Khmer noodle from her house. She could earn for her net income $ 2.00 per day. She lives in the thatch roof and wall for years. Besides her earning, she is taking a loan of $ 350.00 to decorate the wall her house. She wants really to have a small for farming and a big house.

loans.use: to decorate the wall her house.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is already 44 years old. She is married to Efren and they are living in San Antonio, San Agustin, Isabela with their three children: Rosbijin - 20 years old, a high school graduate; Maureen - 17 years old, is also a high school graduate and Efrelyn - 7 years old, is currently an elementary student. Her family is living in their distant and mountainous village. 

Marilyn would like to improve their way of living through her proper and continuous management to her hog raising business. She would like to request a loan from KIVA lenders a loan amount of PHP6, 000 that she can use for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Hog raising is the business maintained by Gloria C.. She is happily married to Armando, a farmer.  Her family lives in the distant place of San Antonio, San Agustin, Isabela, a mountainous and far place. The couple is blessed with three children: Angelina - 13 years old; Angelo - nine years old and Armando C. Jr. - five years old.  All of them are in the elementary level.  Gloria hopes the best for her children that is why, she is working hard in her hog raising business to earn bigger income for them. Her husband works hand in hand with her.   

Gloria would like to buy additional feeds supply for the maintenance of her business. She wanted to seek the assistance of KIVA lenders, requesting the amount of PHP6, 000. This would serve a big help most especially in the maintenance of her hog raising business. She hopes that she could be able to avail the amount of loan she is requesting.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 37 year-old business woman from the village of Cabisera 17-21 Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Ruben who is also her business partner. They have two children and both of them are studying.

Nora and her husband run a livestock business as their main source of income. Her husband is the one responsible for purchasing live cows and carabaos (a type of water buffalo) from different villages and the one who sells in the province of Pangasinan. Nora is in charge of looking for a good animal to purchase. The couple have been in this business since their children were still young.

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to increase their business. It will help the business to be more profitable because she knows that the more livestock they sell, the greater the profits generated.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock.

loans.name: Maria Melba

texts.en: Maria Melba B. is from the village of Bocator, Tangub City. She is 29 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Maria Melba owns and operates an "alimango" (mud crab) fishing business in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Maria Melba joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maria Melba is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools for her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees and to save for future needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and tools for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly Y. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 45 years-old and married with three adult children. Merly owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from selling coconut wine known as "tuba" in the local community. Merly has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Merly joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Merly is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to pay and repair her motorcycle which is a transport vehicle for the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Merly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for and repair a motorcycle

loans.name: Sarith

texts.en:
Mr. Sarith T., 50, (pictured with his wife), has been married since 1988 and has three children: one young daughter and two sons. Both of his sons are in school. The family lives along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His wife, Mrs. Yun Lang, grows vegetables like tomatoes, corn and so on.

Sarith has been a musician since 1986 and hopes to teach his children to become musicians. Hence he is requesting his first loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a piano to teach his eldest son who is learning musical skills. In this way, Sarith’s son will become a musician as well.

loans.use: To purchase a piano to teach his son to become a musician

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 47 years old, married, and is blessed with three children. She is engaged in managing a vegetable production business in the village of Bolinao Aurora, Isabela, with her husband. They help each other in tilling their vegetable farm, planting their different vegetables and maintaining them all throughout the year until their vegetable plants are no longer productive. Then it’s their time to again till their farm to produce another batch of vegetables.

Marieta also sells their harvested products to buyers. She sometimes goes in the market but most of the time she retails in their village.

According to Marieta, their income from the business is very helpful in supporting the education of their children and in providing their basic necessities at home. But, since they want the business become more productive, Marieta is requesting PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders to use as additional business capital.

Marieta has been in love with running the business for already ten years and she wants to spend the rest of her life improving their family source of income for the benefit of her children.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en: Mr. Yoeurn D. lives in Slaeng Kaung village in Takeo province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Ken Rathanak, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income to support the household. Thus, Mr. Yoeurn D. decided to ask for a loan to buy two piglets and a cow for breeding to earn more income. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two piglets and a cow for breeding to earn more income.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita can be described as a generous person because she always believes that it is better to give than to receive. She is 45 years old and has already been a widow for three years. She has two children who are presently studying. Cherry, her eldest, is now 17 years old and is currently in third year college. Maricris, 16, is now graduating from high school. She is a proud parent because she sees in them enthusiasm for studying. She hopes that she will be able to give them their dreams of finishing their studies even if she is the only one responsible. 

Rosita makes a living through her retailing business since her eldest started studying. She is managing a variety store located in front of their house. In the afternoon, she sells various snacks in their village to have additional income. She had managed a school canteen but now decided to operate a general store just in their house. Rosita is now asking for a business capital loan amounting to PHP 10,000 for her store improvement. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her loan request.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow and two piglets for breeding

loans.name: Chenta

texts.en:
Mrs. Chenta S., age 29 (shown in picture with her husband), and her husband Mr. Thol Sorn, age 31, were married in 2002 and have two sons and one daughter. One of them attends school and other two are still young. The family lives along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chenda has been growing vegetable for 7 years. Mr. Thol Sorn has been a construction worker for about 6 months. He works in other districts far a way from his house. Chenda is requesting her first loan of $500 to make sheathing the plans from sun.

loans.use: To make sheathing the plans from sun.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 29 years old. She is engaged in a hog-raising business, located in their backyard. They are living in Bolinao Aurora, Isabela. Managing her piggery business with the support of her husband is quite good because it helps her family a lot in providing most of their needs at home. She has been in the business for two years and dreams of continuing her business with improvements until her child reaches college studies.

She is asking from KIVA lenders the amount of PHP 10,000 as additional capital to provide her livestock their feed supply. She will utilize the loan in the maintenance of her business that will eventually be helpful in sending her child to school. She will work hard and be alert to help grow her business and reach out for her dreams someday.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy Y., 41, replaced by her husband and daughter in the photo, has been married since 1980 and has six children: four sons and two daughters. One of them is married but lives in the family home. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn City.
 
Thy has been selling flowers since she was young, a skill she leaned from her mother. She buys them from her villagers for resale at Central market located in Phnom Penh. She is able to earn a profit of 70,000 riel (perhaps $17.50) per week. Her husband, Mr. An Some, 43, has been a blacksmith for 28 years. He works in Phnom Penh. 

Thy is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: A widow mother living with three children all of whom are single one is the forehead local construction, K. in the age of 44 survives her living by selling traditional cake through the village for years while her one daughter employs as a garment worker and the other two as the local construction workers. K. has taken a loan of $ 200.00 to buy some construction materials for her children.

loans.use: to buy some construction materials for her children.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Mrs. Vannak N. lives in Roeu Sey Srok village in Takeo province. She is a chicken middle woman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens to resell to earn more profits. Her husband, Mr. Chhoem Touch, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Vannak N. is 28 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more chickens to resell to earn more profits.

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-at T., 27, and her husband Mr. Thong Svay, 28, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have one son and one daughter. Both of them are still young.
 
Sam-at has been a garment factory worker for about 10 years.  Her husband has been a construction worker for a year. He wants to launch a new motor taxi business, so Sam-at is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive as a motor taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive as motor taxi.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie A. is from the simple village of Bolinao Aurora, Isabela. Tessie is engaged in vegetable production and sells their produce in the market and in nearby villages at a lower price, using their motorcycle. Her husband serves as the driver and she is glad that they can earn good income for their family.

They have been doing the business for 12 years. She is now 47 years old and they are blessed with three children, of whom two are already studying. Because she wants their business to become more productive for the welfare of their children, Tessie wants to take out a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 10,000 as additional business capital. She hopes to purchase enough supply of farm inputs needed in the maintenance of their vegetable farm and also pay for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Mrs. Lay D. is a villager in Slaeng Kaung village in Takeo province. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fruit to resell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Kiev Pich, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. Mrs. Lay D. is 57-years-old and the mother of seven children, five of whom are workers in different positions, while another is a fruit seller, and the last is attending the local school. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to resell to earn more income.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sam-Ol

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-ol O., age 30 and his wife. Soknhoem Um, age 31, live in a small village along national road number four approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penn City. They have been married since 2003 and have one son and one daughter. 
 
Sam-ol has been renting a space of house to garment factory workers for 3 years. Because his house located near garment factory, it’s good for him to operate the business. His wife has been selling grocery for almost 2 years. 

Sa-ol needs to build more rooms to respond his customer’s needs so he is applying for his first loan of $1,200 to make the building.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es una amable mujer de 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo José, quien es chofer y sus hijos Aurora de 11 años y Jhon de 7 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y salchipapas (papas con salchichas fritas) en la puerta de su casa, esta actividad la viene realizando hace un año, cuando por iniciativa propia decidió ser independiente al sueldo de su esposo, colaborar con los gastos del hogar y poder brindarle a su familia un ingreso extra y mayores posibilidades de salir adelante. A Blanca le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que siempre tuvo un don para la cocina siendo este oficio más que un trabajo un pasatiempo. Aunque no todo es fácil, ya que muchas veces la demanda de sus platillos es muy buena y no se da abasto sola para poder cubrir los gastos para prepararla. En el futuro desea tener cafetería en un ambiente de su casa y más adelante, un restaurante.
Este es su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, asimismo se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Blanca solicita 1000 soles para comprar mayor cantidad de insumos y productos para preparar sus ricos platillos, así como acondicionar un ambiente dentro de su casa para instalar pronto su cafetería.
texts.en:
Blanca is a friendly woman who is 38 years old. She lives with her husband José, who is a chauffeur, and her children Aurora (age 11) and Jhon (age 7). She sells hamburgers and salchipapas (fried potatoes with sausages) outside the door of her house. Blanca started her business a year ago when she took the initiative and decided to earn her own income that was separate from her husband’s. Now they both contribute to the household expenses and she is able to provide her family with extra income and better possibilities of getting ahead.

Blanca enjoys what she does because she has always had a gift for cooking and her work feels more like a hobby instead of a job. Everything has not been easy. There have been many times when demand for her dishes has been very good, but she ran out of supplies because she did not have the funds available to prepare more food. In the future, she hopes to open a cafeteria in her home, and later a restaurant.

This is Blanca’s second loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She promises to make her payments on time. Blanca is requesting 1000 soles to buy large quantities of supplies and products for preparing her rich dishes, as well as remodel the outside of her house so that she can open a cafeteria.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing fast food

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: A widow mother K., 50, lives in the thatch house with her children; two of them are the students and the rest employ as the worker in the factory and one is the forehead of the local construction. Because she is good at producing a delicious traditional cake, she also earns her living condition by selling it to the villagers. She has been in this business for years while her son owns a business of local construction in Phnom Penh. K. is taking a loan of $ 1, 000.00 for her son to invest the local construction business for a more income. She does really want her other two children finish bachelor degree.

loans.use: to invest the local construction business for a more income.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth A. is a native of the island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She believes that the will and the way to get out from poverty must be anchored with industry and hard work.  She is married to Victor who is 45 years old and a fisherman. She is a mother to six; four sons and two daughters.
 She and her husband are partners in their fishing business. She has been doing it for twenty three years already and her major source of livelihood. This is her primary business. Aside from fishing, she is also doing the vegetable and dried fish vending as her secondary business. She wanted to invest more on her businesses.
She became of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) member, an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2009. When she received her first loan, she was given hope to improve her business. And now on her second loan, she proposes a loan of 10,000 PHP as additional capital for her fishing business and part will go to her secondary business. The loan will be used to pay for 1 bundle fishnet, fingerlings, and part of the amount will go to her secondary business.
She is hopeful that with the help of ASHI and trust of KIVA lenders, she can improve her business and can slowly reach her aspiration to get out from poverty. She also dreams of sending all of her children to school until they finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: To pay for 1 bundle fishnet, fingerlings, and part of the amount will go to her secondary business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 44 años, comparte su vida a lado de su esposo Elmer, de 49 años, y sus 3 hijas: Estefany de 20, Jessica de 13 y Coraima de 9 años de edad, en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de turrones, especie de queque elaborado con harina, huevo, frutas secas, miel y golosinas, siendo uno de los postres más deliciosos y solicitados en los meses de setiembre y octubre, debido a que es tradicional durante el tiempo de la procesión religiosa de la imagen del “Señor de los milagros”. De esta manera Gladys ofrece durante este tiempo turrones, que a diferencia de otros meses incursiona en otras actividades, como la venta de productos de belleza o la venta de ropa a domicilio. Ella considera que trabajando en diferentes oficios le da la libertad de aprovechar las temporadas y así obtener más ingresos para su familia. 
Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y se compromete a ser puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el préstamo que solicita comprará más turrones, ya que piensa venderlos toda la temporada para que con las ganancias pueda instalar una librería en su casa y con este negocio pueda estar más cómoda y cercad de su familia.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophan P., age 32 and her husband Mr. Channak Morn, age 33, were married in 1998 and have two children: one son and one daughter. All of them are still young. Besides of her children, she also have her parents are living with her. They live along National Road Number five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sophan has been a garment factory worker since 2001.  She wants to create new selling grocery business, so she is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a shop for operating grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a shop for operating grocery store.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda T. is from the village of Puli, Canitoan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 50 years old. Belinda is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Belinda owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Belinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Belinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Belinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles S. is from the village of Pangabuan, Tangub City. She is 48-years-old. Angeles is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Angeles owns and operates an "alimango" fishing retail business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Angeles has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Angeles joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angeles has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Angeles is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seafood to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Angeles from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children and to be used for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seafood to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre de 37 años, vive con Jesús, su esposo, y su hijo Yomar de 6 añitos, en su casa propia. Ella y su esposo trabajan incansablemente para brindarle a su hijo un futuro mejor, por ello su negocio de venta de madera lleva el nombre de su hijo, una manera de cábala para tener suerte en el negocio. Es así que hace algunos años esta actividad se ha convertido en la fuente de ingresos de la familia, pues gracias al empeño con que lo realizan obtienen buenas ganancias. Desde entonces, Jesús viaja constantemente a otras ciudades para dejar los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, siendo su trabajo de mucha demanda, mientras que Hilda administra todos los pedidos que van llegando. Ambos están muy contentos con su trabajo porque saben que en el futuro cosecharán buenos frutos, ya que su negocio va creciendo poco a poco y será cada vez más rentable. 
Este es el segundo préstamo de Hilda con MFP y ha demostrado ser muy puntual en todos los pagos, de sus créditos anteriores. El dinero que ahora solicita será para la comprar mayor cantidad de madera, la cual venderán en otras ciudades para aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
S., 38, is a widow who has been living with her sister for many years; she has no children. Her sister is a garment worker. S. earns her living selling traditional cake for which she is famous. She is very skilled and everyone appreciates it. She has a small plot of land derived from her parents along the village road. She is a very kind person in the village. She wants to buy a motorbike for her sister's transportation with this loan.

S. said she will open a new small grocery store by her house when she can possibly earn enough for that. This is the rainy season and the month for flooding so her house is full of water underneath and the other houses are, too.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her sister's transportation.

loans.name: Lucilda

texts.es: Lucilda tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo Florentino, y sus 6 hijos: José de 17, Julio de 14, Luis de 12, Raúl de 10, Kevin de 7 y Milagros de 5 años de edad, todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta y distribución de balones de gas, sus hijos la ayudan en el negocio por ser una actividad que necesita de gran esfuerzo físico. De esta manera Lucilda recibe los pedidos por teléfono y su hijo mayor los distribuye en su moto. Ella está muy feliz, ya que su negocio le resulta rentable y cada vez va creciendo más, es por ello que desea ampliar el ambiente que tiene para almacenar sus balones. Su deseo a futuro es tener una distribuidora de este combustible doméstico, además de comprar más motos y contratar personal. Es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, ella siempre ha pagado puntualmente todas sus cuotas, al igual que el resto de sus compañeros de grupo. Con el dinero que viene solicitando desea comprar mayor cantidad de balones de gas para abastecer su almacén y aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Lucilda is 37 years old and lives in a house with her husband Florentino and her 6 children: 17-year-old José, 14-year-old Julio, 12-year-old Luis, 10-year-old Raúl, 7-year-old Kevin and 5-year-old Milagros. For the past 4 years she has dedicated herself professionally to the sale and distribution of gas tanks. Her children help her in the business because it is a job that is physically demanding. In this way Lucilda receives the requests by telephone and her oldest son distributes the tanks on his motorbike. Lucilda is very happy now that her business is making money and growing. It is because of this that she wants to increase the room that she has to store the tanks. Her wish for the future is to have a distribution center for this gas, in addition to buying more motor bikes and contract outside workers. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has always payed punctually as have the rest of the members of her group. With the money that she is requesting, she wishes to buy more gas tanks to stock her storeroom and increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase commodities

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Mrs. Soy C. lives in Proeus Leu village in Takeo province. She is a clothes seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more clothes to sell to earn more income. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell to earn more income.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Mr. Dy S., 62, (shown in the picture with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Sokha Chhet, 53, live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1970 and have three sons and three daughters. Four of them were married and live outside the family home, one son is a teacher and another son attends school.

Dy has been a farmer since 1979. He grows cauliflowers and cucumbers in the farmland in his village. His wife has been selling grocery for 2 years. One of his daughters is a hair dresser, but she doesn’t have enough materials for operating the business.

Hence Dy is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase materials for hair and beauty salon for his daughter’s business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for hair and beauty salon for his daughter who is a hair dresser.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una mujer muy trabajadora D. 34 años, vive con su hija DomitiL. D. 8 años, en su casa propia. DesD. hace 5 años se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza, ofreciendo sus productos a sus vecinas, amigas y familiares a través D. los catálogos y revistas D. diferentes compañías D. cosméticos con las cuales trabaja. A María le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que además D. vender los productos también ofrece consejos D. maquillaje, enseñando L. combinación D. tonos en el rostro. Sin embargo, muchas veces algunas clientes no le pagan en su momento, teniendo que realizar varias visitas para cobrar, lo que le resulta muy incómodo. A pesar D. ello, se encuentra contenta con su trabajo porque le permite tener mucha libertad en cuanto a horarios y pueD. salir a las horas que elL. vea por conveniente y organizarse mejor con los quehaceres del hogar. En el futuro desea tener un bazar donD. ofrezca sus productos D. belleza, así como adornos y otros artículos. Este el sétimo préstamo D. María con MFP, elL. es muy puntual en todas sus cuotas, ya que su grupo acostumbran ser muy estricto con los pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita será para L. compra D. más cosméticos para tener mercadería en stock, en especial con L. llegada D. L. temporada D. primavera, cuando hay mayor demanda.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Borin

texts.en:
Mr. Borin P., 37, and his wife, Mrs. It Oem, 32, have been married since 2000. They have three children, one son and two daughters, all of whom are still young. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Borin has been farming for 10 years, while his wife has been selling fish for 10 years.  The house where the family lives is old and is in need of repair. Therefore, Borin is requesting his first loan of $500 to purchase wooden materials to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase wooden materials to renovate his house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijas en su casa propia. Desde muy joven ha incursionado en varios negocios para poder brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Ahora que sus hijos ya están grandes y formaron su propia familia, ella desea que sigan su ejemplo, es por ello que los apoya cada vez que quieren enrumbar un negocio. Por tal motivo, junto a su hija han decido vender comida y desde hace algunos días se han instalado en una de las calles más concurridas de su distrito con un puesto de comida. Su hija es quien administra el negocio y cocina los ricos platillos, mientras que María la ayuda en la atención de la clientela. Para el futuro esperan tener un restaurante y extender su negocio.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual y responsable en el momento de pagar sus cuotas. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual y responsable en el momento de pagar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and lives with her husband and daughters in their own house. Since she was very young, she has ventured into many businesses so that she can offer her family a good quality of life. Now that her children are grown-up and have their own families, she wants them to follow her example. Because of this, she supports them each time they want to start a business. For this reason, she and her daughter have decided to sell food and for many days, they work in one of the busiest streets in their area with a food stall. Her daughter manages the business and cooks the delicious plates, while María helps her take care of the clients. In the future, they hope to have a restaurant and grow their business. This is her third loan with MFP, and she has always been very punctual and responsible in her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils and furniture for her business

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en: Virginita M. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 46 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Virginita owns and operates a fish vending business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Virginita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to as additional capital for her fish and shrimp vending business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: A local country face of a small family living in the quiet and peaceful village near the town, N., 36, and her partner life Thol, 42, had been married for years and gave birth to four children all of whom are single and live with her except lives separately in Phnom Penh. Family has business of selling rattan cupboard for years and has a good income supported. Recently, the two family leaders agreed to buy a loan from HKL to invest in their business process. They hope that their children will finish university.

loans.use: to invest in their business process.

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en:
Milicent is a 23-year-old married mother of two school-going children. She lives with her family in Nyalenda, Kisumu, Kenya.

Milicent owns a tailoring/dressmaking shop which she started in 2008. She specializes in making both ladies’ and gents' clothes. She requires Kshs 20,000 to increase her stock of tailoring materials so as to cope with increased demand.

loans.use: To increase her stock of tailoring materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Harriet Nakalema ‘S Group

texts.en: Harriet is a 32 year married with four children aged between 21/2 and 16 years. Three of her children go to school. Harriet resides and owns a four roomed house where she staying with eight people. There is electricity and piped water at home.  Harriet takes care of additional family members  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 82 customers a day. Harriet sells second hand clothes in Bwaise Market.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. work.  The major challenges she faces in her business are monthly market dues, medication, thieves, feeding the family and increasing prices of clothes. Besides this clothing business she also sells fruits. Harriet has been in this business for 4 years and with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of clothes Harriet is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permant business structure.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim H., age 62, lives along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has five children: one son and four daughters. Four of them were married and live outside the family home and the other one is a garment factory worker. 

Sim has been selling meals in front of a garment factory for five years. Besides this business, she also grows rice. Sim doesn’t have enough capital to use for farming so she is applying for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase a water pumping machine, pipe, rice seed and pesticide.

loans.use: To purchase water pumping machine, pipe, rice seed and pesticide for her growing rice business.

loans.name: Niliver

texts.es:
Niliver  tiene 25 años, vive con su esposa Felipa y sus 3 hijos: Verónica de 26, Jonathan de 23, Jacky de 22, en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de bolsas de plástico, su forma de trabajo es coordinando con las grandes empresas que fabrican estas bolsas y les compra las que les sobran de los grandes pedidos que ellas manejan. Así, Niliver las compra a un precio menor y las vende al precio de mercado. Hasta el momento el negocio le va muy bien, ya que ofrece su mercadería a tiendas de los mercados más conocidos de su ciudad. A él le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y complementar con las ganancias que aporta su esposa con la venta de artículos según la temporada. De esta manera, ambos se ayudan y salen adelante para darles bienestar a sus hijos.
Es su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos, ya que su grupo es muy exigente a la hora de cumplir con ellos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará otra cantidad de bolsas para esta temporada de primavera, ya que promete ser muy buena la venta.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is a 23 year old married mother of one child. She lives with her family in Nyalenda Kisumu, Kenya. She currently sells secondhand clothes, which she started to do in 2003. She buys her stock in bulk at one of the local markets and sells to her clients. She requires Kshs 20,000 to improve her stock level.

loans.use: Improve her stock level

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a married mother of two children. She lives in Nyamasaria where she also runs a charcoal business. She buys bags of charcoal in bulk and sells to other retail outlets. She has applied for Kshs 20,000 to get more stock.

loans.use: Buy more stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet tiene 38 años, vive con su pareja, Efraín, y sus 2 hijas: Soraya de 19 y Claudia de 17 años, en su casa propia. Desde hace un año ha incursionado en la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que le gusta mucho ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos, además este trabajo le ha ayudado a ser independiente y generar sus propios recursos económicos, además de los que provee su pareja. Yanet quiere brindarles a sus hijas estudios superiores y que se puedan forjar un futuro profesional, es por ello que le pone mucho empeño a su trabajo, siendo muchas veces baja la venta. Pese a ello, no se amilana y trata de ponerle muchas ganas, ya que en el futuro quiere instalar un negocio más rentable y para ello ha pensando comprar un motocarro para que con éste pueda brindar el servicio de taxi.
Es su sétimo préstamo con MFP y por ser una persona muy puntual en sus pagos se ha ganado el respeto y cariño de su grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock, también invertirá en el pago de una letra del motocarro que quiere comprar a plazos.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Kimleang

texts.en:
Mr. Kimleang K., age 23 and his wife, Mrs. Chantheang Srun, age 20, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penn City. They have been married since 2002 and just have a one-year-old daughter.
 
Kimleang and his wife sell bananas and flowers.  They buy banana and flower from their villager and other districts far a way from their house for resale in Phnom Penh market. The couple hopes to expand their business, so Kimleang is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase more bananas and flowers for resale. They will able to generate much income for supporting their family as well.

loans.use: To purchase expand his selling bananas and flowers business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is married to Jimmy P. Sr. She is already 35 years old and was a mother of three children: Jaylord - 14 years old; Jimmy P. Jr. - 10 years old and Jestony - 4 years old. She hopes to give their three children with a proper education which they will be used in searching for better jobs someday. Catalina and husband then work very hard for the fulfillment of their ambition for their children to have in the future. 

Hog raising is being manage by Catalina to earn income while her husband manages their upland farming business.  Catalina also sometimes sells vegetables in their village to generate additional income. Her desire to improve her business motivates her to request for a loan of PHP6, 000 from the KIVA lenders. She is hoping that she could avail the loan amount she is requesting for her business to grow further.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Lilian Kizza's Group

texts.en:
Lilian is the leader of a 2-member group. She is 29 and married with 3 children aged between 4 and 10 years old. All her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with six people. They have electricity but no piped water at home The family gets three meals a day.

Lilian works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She works in Ntinda market near Kampala city selling matooke (green bananas). Lilian works seven days a week and doesn’t incur any additional transport because she buys from her place of work. Lillian sells to an average of 25 customers a day and sells to all categories of people on retail.

Lillian has been in this business for five years and has been a member of MCDT for six years, servicing her twelfth loan. Lillian's monthly expenses include rent and also daily market dues. She wants to buy more bananas and aspires to sell only wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Sasfy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sasfy L., 21, and her husband, Mr. Man Kob, 34, were married in 2000 and have four children. They have three sons and one daughter. Two of the children are in school. The famiL. lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sasfy has been selling clothes for 10 years. She buys clothes from market located in Phnom Penh for resale in her village. Her husband has been a construction worker for five months. He works in his village. 

Sasfy wants to expand her business to become bigger and so she will able to generate more income.  She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.use: To expand her selling clothes business.

loans.name: Din

texts.en: D., 35, is a local handicap maker such as cupboard, table, bed from the rattan and wood to the villages and communes. His partner life is Sdeng, 32, is a seller of local house window and door trader. They married had given birth three children all of whom are single and attend school. They all want to increase their business by raising the numbers of producing and more import of the materials from the local villagers. So D. decided to buy a loan of $ 300.00 from HKL to invest in his furniture making and his wife trade. D. was not available during the photograph so his wife is taken instead.

loans.use: to invest in his furniture making and his wife trade.

loans.name: Mr. Chamnab Kit Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en: A village bank loan which consists of seventeen people is located in Thmei village in Takeo province and all the members will use the loan in different purposes. Mr. Chamnab K. is the village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In his plantation, he needs pesticides to kill insects. In order to deal this problem, he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and he would use the rest of loan to hire laborers to work on the field. His wife, Mrs. K. Seng Ly, is a weaver. Mr. Chamnab K. is 35 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan pesticides to kill insects and he would use the rest of loan to hire laborers to work on the field.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lota

texts.en:
Lota M. is from the village of D-6, Canitoan, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 51 years old. Lota is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Lota owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling rice and 'longganisa' in the local community. Lota has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lota joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lota is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lota from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Emmaculada

texts.en:
Emmaculada is engaged in buying and selling of used emptied bottles in their whole village of Cabisera 17-21 through the aid of their motor vehicle. Aside from this, she is also purchasing ten kiloa of longganisa once a week as additional source of income. For the continuous improvement of her business, she is now requesting to borrow a loan of PHP10,000.  This amount will be of great help in maintaining her buy and sell business and so with their motorcycle that they are also using as their service.  

Emmaculada is 32 years old.  They live in Cabisera 17-21 of ILagan, Isabela.  She is married to Jerivic, a tricycle operator and they have two children.  The eldest is now 15 years old, presently studying in high school. Their youngest is just nine months old. Emmaculada never lose hopes even if sometimes there are trials that come along their way. According to her, she always surrenders her problems to our loving God who never left them.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
“While there is life, there is hope,” this is Adelaida’s principle in life. She is 20 years old and married to Joji M., a tricycle [local three-wheeled transport vehicle] driver. Having a family at a very young age was hard for her but she always believes that they will overcome every trial in life that will come along. They have two children who are both studying. Their eldest is eight years old and their youngest is four. She dreams of sending them both to college someday which is the reason why the couple is working hard with their livelihood activity.

Adelaida and her husband help each other in their transportation business. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 for the continuous maintenance of their transportation business. To help her husband in bringing income for their family, Adelaida also started helping her sister in selling commodities in her canteen located in the school where her sister is giving her a voluntary labor fee. According to her, doing everything to the best of her ability will be done in order to sustain her family needs and to support their children's education.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Mr. Vaen Vann Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
Ten people who are all living in Thlok village in Takeo province make up the village bank loan. Mr. Vaen V. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.  They all will use the loan for different purposes.  Mr. Vaen V. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice to earn a living. He is a 62-year-old widower with three children, two of whom are marketing employers and the third child helps with his father’s work. Now Mr. Vaen V. is requesting a loan to buy piglets and chickens for breeding to earn income for his household. 

Four members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy piglets and chickens for breeding to earn income for his household.

loans.name: Manayon

texts.en:
Manayon is already 47 years old. She is married to Conrado C.. The couple is blessed with three children and all of them are already married. Manayon is a seamstress in their village. She sews pillow covers, bed sheets, and also dresses. She is thankful because through the business she is managing, she is able to earn money for the needs of her family.

She would like to ask financial support from KIVA lenders so that she could be able to purchase needed materials for her sewing business. She is asking the amount of PHP 6,000 that will be used for the development of her sewing business that helps her and her husband provide for their children with financial help when they needed it. Doing this is because of their grandchildren, too.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
This is Fe P., 50 years old, wife to a golf-club caddy. Two of their nine children are enrolled in high school. They live in Maricaban, Pasay City.

Fe has been selling golf balls at the golf course where her husband has been working for twenty years. She earns P 15,000 a month. She was able to support the education of her children using her profits from the business.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2003. Her loans are useful to sustain her business. She was able to acquire a rented space for her business in front of the golf course through her loans from CCT. Fe is planning to venture into an additional business – buying and selling vegetables and fruits. She applied for a new loan in the amount of P 27,000 to undertake this.

Fe knows the value of education; that’s why she works hard hand-in-hand with her husband to support their children’s education.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: new business venture: buying and selling fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra P. is from the village of Puli, Carmen Cagayan De Oro City. She is 42 years old. Isidra is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Isidra owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as perfumes, a variety of clothing, lotion, shampoo and others in the local community. Isidra has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Isidra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isidra is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Isidra from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her child.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 50 years old and blessed with three children. She is already ten years managing a simple furniture business with her husband. Their incomes from the business enable them to pay for the tuition fees of children during their studies from elementary till college. She also uses her loan in improving her business and supports the immediate members of the family. For their business to grow and become competent, Marilyn is requesting to avail the amount of PHP10, 000 from lenders as added capital in purchasing woods and other materials they needed in manufacturing furniture.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Fermina C. from the village of Bolinao Aurora, Isabela, is engaged in managing a general store. She has been three years in the business; she retails different goods in her variety store. Fermina is already 41 years old, she is blessed with two children. Her profits gained from her business are used for the maintenance of the business and to support the education of her two children. She wants the business to improve by adding some items that are not yet available in the store.

For this reason, Fermina is requesting the amount of PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders as additional business capital. Fermina is happy that her husband and children are very cooperative in the maintenance of their business. She hopes someday that through the business, her family may live a progressive lifestyle.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia has been managing a small variety store in front of their house. It has been her business for five years and she wants to further improve it. She is hoping to access a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 for the further growth of her vending stall. Her business is one of their sources of income and is one way to help her husband in generating income for the education of their children. The children are their inspiration in working hard in their business as they aspire to give them a good future.

Lydia is already 45 years old. Her family is residing in Cabisera 17-21 Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Alfredo U. who is already 49 years old. They have four children of whom two are presently studying. Their eldest, Jeffrey, is already a soldier and is working. Janice, who graduated in Criminology, is presently looking for a job. Joem, their third child, is studying in high school. Their youngest, Jincky, is also studying in primary school. Lydia is hoping that with the cooperation of her husband, they will be continuously able to send their children to college until they earn their college degree.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en: Nuru is 40single mother of four children aged between 5 and 18 years. All her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Nuru resides and owns a four roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Ndeeba Kizito Zone. Nuru works seven days a week.  Nuru owns stall selling Bananas ( matooke )in Ndeeba Market. She buys her bananas from the delivery trucks which get them villages and doesn’t incur any transport costs.  Nuru pays monthly market dues.  She sells to all categories of people and on both retail and whole sale and besides Nuru has been in this business for eighteen years and with MCDT for seven years servicing her eighteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas Nuru is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and start going to get the bananas her self.

loans.use: To buy more bunches bananas

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne owns a salon. She is a 25-year-old married mother of one child.  She runs her salon at the Kisumu bus terminus. She has applied for a loan of 15,000 KES to buy stock of salon materials.

loans.use: Buy stock of salon materials.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is already 36 years old. She is the wife of Lary T.. She is a raiser of goat in the village of San Antonio San Agustin, Isabela. According to Esther, their place is too far and was along the mountainside of Sierra Madre Mountains. Despite of that, Esther is happily lives there because the place is peaceful considering that her whole family also lives there. Esther would like to manage well her goat raising business to be able to generate bigger income for her family need.

Esther and Lary is blessed with three children: Genie Rose - 9 years old; Jane Claude - 7 years old and Jeriebeth - 5 years old. All are attending school. Esther wanted the best education to give to her three children but since her family lacks of livelihood resources worries of not able to afford them sending to college someday. The couple wanted their children finish a higher level of education and for this reason, she would like to ask additional business capital amounting PHP6, 000 for the maintenance of her goat raising business. Esther would be glad if her loan request will be approve.

loans.use: additional capital

To make a living, Rachelle owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail store. Rachelle is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rachelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mr. Thy T. is a villager in Trapaing Knol village in Takeo province. He is a breeder who raises pig, duck and cow. Since these breeding businesses are going well, he wants to expand it so he decided to ask for a loan to buy two piglets, 500-duck and a cow for his current breeding business. His wife, Mrs. Tong Keng, helps him on the businesses. Mr. Thy T. is 45 years old and the father of nine children three of whom are employed in a casino club while other three are attending the local school. The other three stay at home because they are too young to work and study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two piglets, 500-duck and a cow for his current breeding business.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Aside from being a farmer, Nestor has also been operating his passenger tricycle since it was being purchased on an installment basis in the year 2005. He is asking for financial assistance for the maintenance of his passenger tricycle. He is also planning to open a retailing business that his wife will look after. He hopes that through the assistance of lenders, he could easily achieve his business goals. He is asking for a loan of Php 6,000. This is all for the benefit of their only child in the future.

Nestor is already 49 years old and is married to Annalyn who is a plain housewife. They have only one child named Christian Dave who is just four years old. Christian is already studying in the primary school in kindergarten. The couple hopes that Christian will have a good future ahead of him if they provide him a complete education. Nestor hopes that as the head of the family, he’ll be a good provider to his family and someday could send his child in college until he is able to finish it.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Managing a tricycle transport business and hog raising business is the one that Catherine R. chooses to engaged with. Their daily income from their tricycle transport was being divided for their daily family needs, allowances of their children in school and feeds supply that her raised pig needed to grow. In this regard, she wanted to ask for financial assistance from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP4, 000 as additional business capital to further maintain her livestock and motorcycle transport business. 

She is living with her family in the village of Old Centro 1 San Mateo, Isabela. Catherine is already 27 years old and is being married to Rey R. who is a farmer. Her family has harmonious a relationship that Catherine use to make her happy. She hopes to give her family with a better living someday through their simple livelihood in their village.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa A. is a woman who has faith and determination to bring her family out from the spiral of poverty. She is 31-year-old and a mother to Mary Ann who is 7 years old and an elementary pupil. Her husband Allan is her business partner.
For more than two years already, they had been doing the fishing business. Fishing is one of the major sources of livelihood in their village since it is surrounded with lake. They catch fish trough fishnets. They sell the fish in their village and some are brought to the market. The business runs smoothly and it brings them enough proceeds to sustain the needs of them family.
Just recently, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with full of hope to have access to capital for her business. When she received her first loan, she carefully spent it in the purchase of fishing gears. Now she is about to received her requested loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for second-hand boat and bundles of fishnets for fishing purposes.
She is positive that she can reach her dreams slowly-by-slowly with the help of ASHI and trust of KIVA.  She really dreams of sending her only child to school until she finish her college and find job. She dreams of having huge fishing boat.

loans.use: To pay for second-hand boat and bundles of fishnets for fishing purposes.

loans.use: to improve her business

Gloria A. is already 50 years old yet still is an active hog-raiser, a small entrepreneur in their village of San Antonio San Agustin, Isabela. She manages the hog-raising business which serves as their alternative source of income in the village to support their family's daily needs. She wants to achieve success in life, that’s why she is striving to further improve their way of living.

Due to the occurrence of swine disease in their area, Gloria is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 to buy the medication for her pigs and also to buy enough feed for her pigs. Gloria is hoping that her business may able to surpass the swine problem that is happening in their area because having the business is really of big impact to their survival and to the education of some of her children.

She hopes that lenders will lend her loans because through her business she can fulfill her dreams for her children  which is to finish their studies until college to able employ for decent jobs someday.

Sr. The couple is blessed with six children who are Dominador - 30 years old, he is a college graduate; Virgilio M. Jr. - 27 years old; Brenda - 25 years old; Regovil - 23 years old; Jovilyn - 20 years old and Jeffrey - 13 years old. Estela is hoping to uplift her family from poor living condition thus asking for the assistance of KIVA lenders to her business. 

Estela is living in the village of San Antonio in San Agustin, Isabela together with her whole family. She wanted to buy feeds for her hogs. She hopes to avail the amount of PHP6, 000 as additional business capital to maintain her hog raising business. Estela is also hoping to improve her business so that, she could be able to garner bigger income for her family.

loans.name: Dara

texts.en:
Mrs. Dara S., 48, lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, was married in 1980. She has four sons and two daughters. One of them is married and lives in separated home, two others have full time employment and one attends school. 

Dara has been a silk weaver since 1980, a having skill she learned from her mother. While her husband been a policeman for the same years. She now wants to supplements another selling silk fabrics business to add to her own products, Dara is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase finished fabrics from other weavers for sale.

loans.use: To purchase finished silk fabric for resale.

Belen M. is from Bañadero, Ozamiz City. She is 45-years-old.  Belen is married and has five school-age children. To make a living, Belen owns and operates a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing parlor services in the local community.  Belen has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Belen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Belen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Sreythom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreythom B., age 44 (shown in the photo with her husband), and her husband, Mr. Kea Yun, age 48, were married in 1988 and have three sons. The eldest son is a driver and construction worker and the other two attend school. They are living in a small village off of National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sreythom has been selling groceries, vegetables and meat for eight years. She buys them from Takhmao market for resale in front of her house in the village. Mr. Kea Yun has been farming for ten years. In the past, he was a soldier.

Sreythom wants to expand her business, because then it will be possible for her to generate more income to better support her standard of living. She is requesting her first loan of $700 to purchase more grocery items, meat and vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Pilar

Pilar G. is blessed with four children; luckily she is able to nurture them with the help of her general store that is contributing a lot to supporting their family. Her four children are not all studying. They are living in the simple community of Bolinao Aurora, Isabela. Her family lives in that place happy and contented. Pilar also is happy that her family has a good relationship.

She wants her business become progressive and because she lacks with enough business capital, Pilar wants to apply for a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 6,000 that will serve as additional business capital for her store. With already 18 years managing the business, Pilar is hoping that her business will somehow develop its sustainability for the future welfare of her children and whatever purposes may serve to the welfare of her children.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: This is Jocelyn T., 39 years old, who lives in Silang, Cavite. Her husband works as a driver. Both their two children are in grade school. Jocelyn manages her own general store. She opened it only last year but it has already grown rapidly. She also sells pre-paid electronic load credits for mobile phones because almost all her neighbors are now using mobile phones. Her store is located along a busy street so business is brisk and she makes close to P15,000 a month. She has saved much of her profits and recently was able to buy a brand-new motorized tricycle. Jocelyn became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007 and is now on her 6th loan. She applied for a new loan of P11,000 from the cooperative which she will use to open another store. It has been her dream to acquire a property in Tagaytay City, a tourist spot next to her town. Should her dream come true, sooner or later, she said she would also put a grocery store on it. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. loans.name: Nena

Nena O. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 66 years old, married and has 11 grown children. Nena has owned and operated a sari sari, also known as a general store, for over five years. This is her main source of income and it produces approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
