location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sengkun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sengkun T., 54, has one daughter who is a garment factory worker. And three sons- two of them were married and live in separated house and other one weaves silk at home. The family lives on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.
 
Sengkun is a silk weaver. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. She is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena L. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 57 years old, widowed and has three grown children. Nena has owned and operated a retail shop, specializing in green bananas and daily essentials, for over 15 years. As her main source of income, the business generates approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nena joined HSPFI to access their financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous HSPFI loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP. Nena is requesting 14000 PHP, as her fourth HSPFI loan, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena D. is a 43 year-old rice grower. She has nine children; all are school-aged, except for her eldest who is 25 years old. She has been tilling rice fields and farming rice since 2008. Elena hopes that her business will allow her to provide her family with food, clothing and other basic needs.

She would like to request a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Vnetures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farming supplies. Receiving this will help to improve her harvest, as well as, her income.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga B. is from the village of Brgy.4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old, married and has one school-aged child. Dominga has owned and operated a dried fish market for over four years and it is her main source of income. Dominga earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from her market.

In 2009, Dominga joined HSPFI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities through their financial services offerings. Dominga is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to reinvest her profits to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en:
Exaltacion B. is from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old and married with four grown children. To make a living, Exaltacion raises pigs for sale.  She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Exaltacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional pigs. Exaltacion is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feeds and medication. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feeds & medication

loans.name: Humura Kisomoro Kajumba Gertrude Group

texts.en: K. Gertrude is a single woman of fifty years old. She is in a business of selling smoked meat to people and she has been in this business for over ten years. She has five children and of which two are school going and she has one dependent schooling too. She wants to add capital in her business that is she wants to purchase animals herself so that she can sell Smoked meat on large scale to expand her business. She is so encouraging and active business woman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To add capital in her business that is she wants to purchase animals herself so that she can sell smoked meat on large scale to expand her business.

loans.name: Jovel

texts.en: Jovel B. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 23 years old, is married, and has three infant children. Jovel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jovel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. loans.use: To purchase new items to expand his product offering

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife R. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Marife owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In September 2009, Marife joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mersedita

texts.en: Mersedita M. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Mersedita owns and operates a business providing beauty services like manicure and pedicure to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month. In 2009, Mersedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is now 59 years old and she is married to Jesus T. who used to manage their one hectare farm. They have one child who is already 17 years old and is currently studying in college. The couple is living in the village of Malamag West, Tumauini, Isabela. She hopes that their daughter will finish her studies as they work diligently in their respective businesses.

Francisca is engaged in the buy and sell business of vegetables which are being harvested from their own farm. She is hoping to avail a loan amounting to PHP3, 000 in order to have additional business capital in their agriculture and selling business. The loan will be used in purchasing another batch of seeds as well as fertilizers and pesticides so as to use some of it to buy vegetables that she could daily retail in their village. She hopes that her loan will be approved to be able to generate more income for the education of their daughter.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rosemarie lives peacefully outside the city, in the village of San Antonio San Agustin, Isabela. She is happily married to Edmar who manages their farm lot, which is their main source of income. On this lot, Rosemarie manages a hog raising business which, along with caring for her children, keeps her busy. Rosemarie is determined to improve their quality of life and therefore is seeking capital to expand her hog-raising venture.

As part of her plans, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from the KIVA lenders. Rosemarie believes that hardwork and preserverance will help one to achieve their life goals.

Rosemarie and Edmar are striving to achieve their business goals for their children's future. For now, their income allows them to send their children to school. Their children: Errol Jay - 18, Karen Joy - 15 and Kristen Joy - three, are their inspiration to continue to preservere and provide for them.

loans.use: To expand hog-raising business.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en: A 32 years old man K. had married to Sophea, 28, who is a garment worker and gave birth to two children all of whom are still young. K. owns a local glass shop providing services of cutting and fitting to the window, door, cupboard, etc. His wife also raises piglets in the stall behind her house and produces the local white wine as it has beneficial for the piglets food too. She always asks her husband for help during the distilling. K. is taking a loan to buy a number of piglets for her wife. He dreams of having a degree for his children.

loans.use: to buy a number of piglets for her wife.

loans.name: Lordgin

texts.en:
Lordgin is 31 years old and is married to Miguel, a security guard. The couple has been blessed with four children: Melogyn - 13, Clarizza Mae - 10, Mike Angelo – 6 and Christian James - 4. All of her children are studying; the eldest is in high school and the others are in elementary school. Their family lives in the village of San Antonio San Agustin, Isabela.

Lordgin is requesting a loan in the amount of Php 6,000 to buy animal feed for her hog raising business. This business has been very helpful in providing some of her family basic needs, as well as, helping to fund her children's education. She hopes that she will be able to raise the requested amount.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 49 married with six children aged between 18 and 30 years. Three of her children go to school and the rest finished school and got married.  She takes care of additional family members. Margaret resides and owns a five roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Ndeeba Najjannkumbi Kizito Zone. Margaret works seven days a week.  Margaret owns shop selling second hand clothes in Margaret. She buys her merchandise from Owino one of the busiest markets in Kampala city and uses public transport to and from shopping Margaret doesn’t pay rent for her business premises as she works from her home.  She sells to all categories of people and on both retail and whole sale and besides selling second hand clothes she does tailoring when need arisesMargaret has been in this business for fifteen years and with MCDT for seven years servicing her third loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand clothing and clothes materials for tailoring Margaret  is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning whole sale shop

loans.use: to buy more used clothing and clothing materials

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita A. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 68 years old, married and has nine grown children. Rosita has owned and operated a business selling vegetables and breads, among other things, for over five years. This is her main source of income and brings in approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to access their financial services, which would in turn help to improve her living situation and her business skills. Rosita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to to expand her product inventory. This will be Rosita's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to reinvest profits to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand product inventory.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 30 years old and is married to Lorna. He manages a livestock business raising hogs and ducks in their village in San Antonio, San Agustin, Isabela.

Joel wants to improve his way of living by means of developing and progressing his livestock business. That is why he wants to ask for additional business capital of PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders to buy feed for his livestock’s growth. This amount will serve as a big help to Joel’s family. He would be very thankful if the amount of loan he is requesting is approved.

Joel also hopes to give his children a complete education for their future jobs someday. For this reason, Joel and his wife are doing their best by working hard and continuously persevering for the betterment of their poor living conditions.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda manages a hog raising business. According to her, the business is helping them in supporting the education of their children and provides some of their needs at home. She wanted to borrow a loan amounting to pHP10, 000 that will be utilize in the maintenance of her business. She will use it in purchasing stocks of feeds for her hogs and additional piglet.  She hopes that her loan will be granted by the KIVA lenders for it will really help her business and her family. 

Elda is 40 years old and blessed with two children. Aside from her hog raising, she is also selling clothes and blanket in their village at Sto. Nińo Aurora, Isabela. The business she manages really helps her a lot providing her family with their important needs so therefore, she must maintain it well and improve for the future. She will do her best to manage well their source of income to support her family needs and support her child education.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma B. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old and is married. Irma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products including pillow cases and curtains in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In September 2009, Irma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Hog raising is the sole source of income of Arlyn’s family. Arlyn is married to Flor, Jr. and the couple is blessed with a boy named Flor III who is nine years old and already in elementary level.

Arlyn is aiming to improve their poor standard of living so that she can further sustain the needs of her family. She hopes to give her family a progressive living by properly maintaining her hog-raising business that her husband helps her to manage.

Arlyn hopes to borrow PHP 4,000 from Kiva lenders that she will use to purchase hog feed till her pigs became fully grown. She wants to buy her stock of feed in order ensure the growth of her livestock.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica wanted to borrow the amount of PHP4, 000 from KIVA lenders to be used for the improvement of her food snack vending business. Veronica is 34 years old, married to Ronnie B.. Veronica wanted to sustain the needs of her family most especially her three children who were all presently studying. 

Veronica would like to buy more kilos of pork meat for her barbecue vending and other street foods that are in demand in their village.  She just hopes that KIVA lenders will let her borrow her loan request for the improvement of her business to progress.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: This is Luz H., a 41-year-old apartment landlady from Silang, Cavite. She lives with her two adult children. Luz has been managing her own apartment complex for the last eighteen years. She also sells purified drinking water in large containers. She earns at least P20,000 a month and her profits are used to sustain her children’s college education. Luz came across a staff of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005 who explained to her the benefits she can gain from being a member. She became a member a month later. Luz is applying for a loan of P49,000 to undertake a few repairs on some of her apartment units. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To fund minor repairs in her apartment complex

loans.name: Ebb Mae

texts.en: Ebb Mae A. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Ebb Mae owns and operates a specialized retail shop selling video compact discs in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Ebb Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Rodora

texts.en:
Rodora is 37 years old and is married to Edgar. Their family lives in the village of Rizaluna Cordon, Isabela. They are blessed with six children: Jayford -16 years old, an elementary graduate; Edgar Ralph - 13 years old, a grade V pupil; Altea - 10 years old, now in grade II; Elizear – 9 years old, in grade I; John Paul - 4 years old; and Jain Kim - nine months old. The couple hopes that, through their hard work, they can afford to give their six children the education they need. 

Rodora is a dealer of beauty products in their village. Through her patience and sacrifices in selling her products, she is able to sustain the needs of her family. Her husband is engaged in rice-farming from which they get their major needs.

Rodora would like to obtain a loan of PHP 4,000 from Kiva lenders. She believes that this amount will help her business to grow.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 49 and married with six children.  Three of her children go to school.  She takes care of additional family members. Margaret resides and owns a five roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and piped water at home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala. Margaret works seven days a week.  Margaret owns shop selling second hand clothes in Margaret. She buys her merchandise from Owino one of the busiest markets in Kampala city and uses public transport to and from shopping Margaret doesn’t pay rent for her business premises as she works from her home.  She sells to all people on both retail and whole sale and besides selling second hand clothes she does tailoring when need arises Margaret has been in this business for fifteen years and with MCDT for seven years servicing her third loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand clothing and materials for tailoring. Margaret  is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning whole sale shop

loans.use: To buy more used clothing and materials for tailoring

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
This is Gorgonia S., who is 57 years old.  She lives in Silang, Cavite, and has six children, one of whom is in college.  The rest of her children live at home.  She is married to a preacher.  

Gorgonia owns a general store situated in front of their house.  It has been in operation for eight years now.  She laments that competition within is stiff considering that three other stores are located in her immediate area.  But she is thankful that customers are still loyal to her because her store sells more items than others.  Thanks to the loans provided by the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, her store grew steadily.  

She is now on her 4th loan cycle.  She will use the funds to buy more items to sell at her store like charcoal (for fuel), and rice.

Gorgonia hopes to see her children finish their college education.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell like charcoal and rice

loans.name: Sadam

texts.en:
Sadam S. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 18 years old and single. Sadam owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling Ready to Wear goods like dress, bags, sandals and others in the local community. Sadam has been engaged in his business for over 3 years.  

In 2009, Sadam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sadam is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Sadam from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a fish vendor.  She is married to Agusto and he works as a tricycle driver and sometimes they also uses their tricycle as their service in selling fish.  The couple also tills a small farm lot where they also get some of their needed income for their living survival. Maricel is 29 years old. Her goal in life is to supply the needs of her family and send her two children in school. 

Maricel and Agusto is striving for their business improvement. To be able to generate bigger income, they are now asking to avail a loan of PHP5, 000 from the KIVA lenders.  She will use the loan to buy more fish that she will sell in their village. She hopes that she could avail the amount of loan she is requesting for her to sustain all the needs of her family and for her to save money for the future schooling of their two children.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Proeun

texts.en: Proeun N., 37, is married with three young children living at home in the Siem Reap province. She makes and sells cakes, typically making US$5 each day and her husband is a policeman. Her husband, Chon Cheat, typically makes about US$3.5 each day. Proeun N. would like a loan of US$1000 to make a few investments. She will buy a motorbike for a family transportation and reinvest in her cake business.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike and reinvest in the business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena A., 53, lives with her three adult children in Malibay, Pasay City.  One of her children is still in college.

Elena owns a general store.  She opened her store a decade ago and it is steadily growing over the years.  Because of the demand, she recently began selling pre-paid electronic load credits for mobile phones.  Business is brisk and she consistently makes more than $365 net income per month.  She can't afford to hire an assistant yet because she pays for her child’s college education.  She is also nursing a grieving heart because of her husband’s recent passing.  To help her in her grief, she is devoting much of her time in attending to her business.  She also finds time to attend gatherings organized for women entrepreneurs by the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative of which she became a member in 2003.

She is now applying for a loan in the amount of P15,000 to ensure the continuing operation of her business.  She will use the money to buy more grocery items and additional refreshments (soft drinks) to sell.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items and soft drinks

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 54 years old. She is a vendor of food snacks and frozen foods in their village at Barangay Old Centro 1 San Mateo, Isabela. According to her, she would like to buy added stock of frozen foods to able improve her business income. She hopes to improve their poor living situation by working and patiently managing well her business. She wanted to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 that will utilized in her business. 

Carmen ids married to Hagibis and they are blessed with five children: Aprilyn - 25 years old, college graduate; Bummer - 22 years old; Camilo - 20 years old; Dynalyn - 17 years old is a college student; and Edward Paulo - 13 years old is a second year high school student. Carmen hopes that she could continue support the schooling of her children through her business income.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou C. is 33 years old and resides with her husband in Siem Reap province. She and her husband, Van Vat, are local teachers, typically making about US$ 2 every day. This couple has two children living at home to support. Sou C. is asking for a loan of US$ 600 to fix her leaking roof. (Her husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To fix her leaking roof

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a direct seller of MSE and NATASHA products in her village at Old Centro 1 San Mateo, Isabela. She is 50 years old.  She is performing well in her business and hopes to become more productive in order to contribute to the improvement of her standard of living.  Her business is quite difficult because there is sometimes a lean season and there will always be occurrences of calamities. Overcoming the factors affecting her business is what Rebecca prays for. She also wants to increase her working capital for the progress of her business. For this reason, Rebecca is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5,000 to add to her direct selling business capital. 

She hopes the income from her business will grow more so that she will be able to support the education of one of her adult children who is a nursing student. At the moment the courses are too expensive. She is gifted with two children: her eldest is Obrey - 28 years old, who now works as an OFW, and Benedicto S. Jr. - 22 years old, the nursing student. Rebecca hopes that she will be given the loan she has requested for her business because it will help her income to grow and will enable her to support her youngest child.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: A country face family living by farming on a plot of land in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia, K. in the age of 50 years old had married to Sambath, 49, who is a local farmer and a palm climber. K. has five children; one is married and lives separately and the other fours are single while three among them are the students. She owns hectares of farming land derived from her parents. K. has earned a better income from her field. Recently she is looking for a loan to buy one plowing truck for her farming and plowing service.

loans.use: to buy one plowing truck for her farming and plowing service.

loans.name: Soeum

texts.en: Soeum S. is 38 years old and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province. Since 2000, she has been selling coffee and grocery items to earn a living and is able to make US$12 in revenue per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver who typically makes US$8 every day. This couple has five children living at home to support. Soeum S. is asking for a loan of US$800 to expand her grocery and coffee stand.

loans.use: To expand grocery and coffee stand.

loans.name: Aliyyah

texts.en:
Aliyyah S. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 20 years old. Aliyyah is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Aliyyah owns and operates a specialized retail shop where she sells video compact discs and related products in the local community. Aliyyah has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Aliyyah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aliyyah is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a dealer of Avon and Natasha products in her village of Barangay Rizaluna Cordon, Isabela. She is married to Cornilio and they were blessed with four children, three of whom are married. Her husband is engaged in a buying and selling business. He used to sell local DVDs from place to place. Gloria would like to have a stock of AVON and NATASHA products so that she could fill her customers' orders immediately, but since she doesn’t have adequate financial capital she is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 from KIVA lenders to add to her working capital. She hopes that the loan she is requesting will be granted. The couple strives hard to earn money for their family. Gloria said that achieving progress in life is not that easy.  You have to work hard at it in order to attain success in life.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en: Chhoun H., 44, is married and resides in Siem Reap province with her husband and four of her children. Together with her husband, she works making traditional drums to sell to dealers. They typically make about US$ 10 every day. Chhoun is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase tools and materials to make more drums. (Chhoun's husband is pictured here.)

loans.use: To purchase tools and materials to make more drums

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a food vendor in her village. She is 39 years old and married to Lary. Gloria is blessed with three children: John Ryan and John Paul are both 14, and Marielle is 12. All are high school students at the moment. She wants to be able to support her children in their studies until they graduate from college.

A desire to improve her food vending business has encouraged Gloria to ask for additional business capital from KIVA lenders. She hopes to borrow PHP 5, 000, and to make her business productive with the financial support of lenders.

loans.use: to improve her food vending business

loans.name: Motalib

texts.en:
Motalib S. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 44 years old. Motalib is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Motalib owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail shop. The primary source of income for the business comes from selling video compact discs and others products like cell phone accessories in the local community. Motalib has been operating his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Motalib joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Motalib is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items and expand his product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Motalib from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of his family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items and expand his product offering

loans.name: Darlindo

texts.en:
Darlindo is a resident from the village of Bonfal Proper Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is married to Aida and they were gifted with two children: Erwin and Darlene. They are now in their elementary level of education. Darlindo and his wife is hoping for them to finish their studies so that they will find a good job someday.

With regards to this, this couple is saving some of their business income for the future college education of their two children. He manages a tricycle transport and sometimes sells coconut (buko) in Solano, Nueva Vizcaya particularly in the public market. Through his patience in managing his business, Darlindo is able to earn PHP2, 000 monthly incomes which is being utilize for the needs of his family and support for the education of their children. He is asking to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP9, 000 that will be helpful in making his business progressive.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan D., 46, lives in Pasay City. Her husband Rodolfo, 49, is a driver by profession. Their only child is in grade school.

Susan has a general store just in front of their house. As additional source of income, she also ventured into buying and selling cosmetics (direct selling). She earns P10,000 a month, just enough for her small family.

She has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2001. She is now applying for a loan in the amount of P15,000 to buy additional inventory for her store.

She dreams of becoming rich so she could help her neighbors get out of poverty.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional inventory to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen chooses to raise ducks in their simple village at Old Centro 1 San Mateo, Isabela. She is  42 years old and she is married to Edwin P. Sr. who is a rice farmer. She would like to raise well all her poultry ducks so that she could be able to support the needs of her children. She has four children, and they are Herwin - 20 years old, Jovely - 18 years old both of them are high school graduate; Edwin P. Jr. who is four years old and Isabel who is three years old. Helen hopes that she could be able to sustain all the needs of her family by improving her livestock business. This is the reason why she hopes to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 as added business capital.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Enriquieta

texts.en:
Enriquieta C. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Enriquieta is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Enriquieta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail shop. The primary source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and fruits in the local community. Enriquieta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Enriquieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enriquieta is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Enriquieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Glaiza

texts.en:
Glaiza R. is from the village of Brgy.4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 21 years old. Glaiza is separated from her spouse and has 1 child who is an infant. To make a living, Glaiza owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish in the local community. Glaiza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Glaiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glaiza is requesting loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Glaiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Jelisa

texts.en:
Jelisa B. has been in business for eight years now. She is 47 years old and lives in the upland town of Silang in the province of Cavite.

Jelisa owns and manages a tailoring shop where she makes dresses for various people. Adjacent to her tailoring shop is a plastic wares store which she opened recently. Both businesses are situated inside the Silang Public Market. She earns close to P 15,000 net income per month from the combined operation of these businesses.

She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006, the same year she established her plastic wares store. She enjoys a lot of benefits from the cooperative. Her businesses grew dramatically. From her profits, she was able to purchase a plot of land and her future project is to build her own house on it. She was also able to purchase an additional sewing machine.

Jelisa is asking for a loan in the amount of P22,000 for the expansion of her tailoring shop. She’s now geared toward saving more to be able to build her own house soon.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa O. is from the village of Gumbil,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Felipa is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felipa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Felipa has been engaged in her business for over 31 years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Felipa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felipa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Felipa is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Felipa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Brak

texts.en: Brak S. is 49 years old and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province. She is a good house wife cooking for the family members. Her husband is a construction worker who typically makes US$4 every day. This couple has six children, one of who is a soldier and five are students. Brak S. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike for a family transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Alinadjer

texts.en:
Alinadjer A. is from the village of Brgy. 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 23 years old. Alinadjer is single. To make a living, Alinadjer owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling "RTW" (ready to wear) items in the local community. Alinadjer has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alinadjer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alinadjer is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alinadjer from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve and expand his business

loans.name: Volodymir

texts.en:
Volodymir is married and has two children - a daughter (9 years old) and a son (4 years old). Volodymir owns a small business located in a village close to Ivano-Frankovsk town. It is a retail business. Volodymir sells various construction materials as well as small home products.

Volodymir has been in this business for 5 years. He used to work at a construction site, but then decided to start his own business and opened a store in his village. This business is the only source of income for his family.

Volodymir would like to develop his business further. He would like to borrow 10,300 UAH to purchase 200 units of paint. Volodymir's goal is to increase sales so he can make enough money to finish the construction of his own house.

loans.use: to purchase 200 units of paint

loans.name: Ho

texts.en: L., 54, is a widowed mother living with two children under a thatch roof while her other two children are married and live separately. This is the second loan for her from HKL and her first Kiva loan. Her family members sell traditional cake to the villagers. They help earn a living to improve the family's living standards. L. buys bamboo from the villagers and splits the bamboo into smaller pieces for making  basket. She has lately decided to take out a loan to invest in her basket-making.

loans.use: to invest in her basket-making

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
For Francisca, success in life will be fulfilled if you know how to manage it wisely. She is 57 years old and she remains strong and still very busy in her general store business.  She is married to Benjamin and they were blessed with six children and all of them are married. 

Francisca is engaged in vending vegetables to earn money for their daily needs. Aside from vending vegetables she also has a home based store as part of her additional source of income. With this regard, Francisca would like to avail a loan amounting PHP4, 000 to further improve her vending and humble store. She would be very glad if she will be given the chance by the KIVA lenders by lending her loan request.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Lung

texts.en:
Lung B. is married with two children. He lives with his wife in Battambong Province. To make a living, he operates his motor taxi in the town and other nearby markets, typically earning US $6 per day. His wife is involved in a business of selling vegetables at the market, earning an income of US $9 per day. Both of them have to work hard every day to ensure a good living for the family and especially the children.

Therefore, B. is seeking to increase his income and improve his business. He is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase a new motorbike which will consume less gasoline and be efficient enough to generate a better income. By doing so, he believes that he will be able to manage a good standard of living for his family.

loans.use: buy a gas-efficient motorbike

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Ban Moun, 57, is married with two children living at home in Siem Reap province. She works in a grocery store, typically making US$ 5 each day. Her husband is a communal chief. Her husband, Heng Phon, typically makes about US$ 2 each day. Ban Moun would like a loan of US$ 500 to diversify her grocery products.

loans.use: To diversify her grocery products.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Evelyn is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Irma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling general clothing in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,785 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Irma from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sai

texts.en: Sai P. is married with two school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Battambong Province. To make a living, she is engaged in the agriculture sector, growing vegetables, typically earning US $5 per day. Her husband operates his motor taxi at the nearby markets, earning an income of US $3 per day. Both of them have to work hard every day to ensure a good living for the family, especially the children. Therefore, P. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US$ 300 to pay taxes for her husband's motorbike.

loans.use: pay taxes for the motorbike

loans.name: Jeanny

texts.en:
Jeanny R. is from the village of Lupagan,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Jeanny is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeanny owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Jeanny has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 12,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jeanny joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeanny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Jeanny is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jeanny from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong C., 22, is married and lives with her husband and one young child in Kampong Chnang province. Since 2008, she has been working in the garment factory to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 1.60 in profit every day. Her husband, pictured here, is a barber and typically makes US$ 2.50 per day. Kong is asking for a loan of US$ 600 to purchase a motorbike to use to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Phok

texts.en:
Phok N. is married with four children. He lives with his wife (pictured) in Battambong Province.

Phok N. is engaged in selling various kinds of food including porridge, dessert, and pounded papaya, typically earning US$5 per day. His wife helps him in the business every day, and she looks after the household chores. The family is also assisted by the two children who are currently employed in a hotel with an income of US$2.50 each per day.

N. wants to improve his business and generate a better income for the family. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to buy utensils for making fruit shake. By doing so, he will be able to expand his business and attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy utensils for making shake fruit

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
“If you work, you will live, if you are lazy you will get hungry”, this is the philosophy of Zenaida, a hardworking mother residing in Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Despite of her unfinished education, she still have a strong faith and determination to improve their status of living and give their children a better future. Her husband Virgilio is an industrious farmer in their village. He plants rice and some vegetables twice a year. 

Because of their interest to send their children to school, Zenaida decided to engaged in food snack vending. This is also her way of helping her husband earn a living for their family.  Due to lack of capital, she is now asking the KIVA lenders to lend her a loan of PHP5, 000.  She will use the amount to purchase additional merchandise for her business.  She is also hoping to grow her capital, expand her business and be able to put up even a small eatery stall in their house.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S. is from the village of San Antonio, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 30 years-old and married with four school-aged children. Jocelyn owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling a variety of vegetable products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is managing a community-based store in her village of Rizaluna Cordon, Isabela. According to her, she is able to generate a weekly income of PHP 1,000 due to easily selling out the merchandise in her store. For this reason, Teresa would like to request a loan of PHP 5,000 for her to purchase stocks of goods to expand her store, to lessen her transport expenses and to increase her daily income.

Teresa is married to Rolando, a simple farmer. They are helping each other in the growth of their livelihood for the future of their family especially their children. They hope to give their children an improved life someday and to do this they must work hard, be patient always and learn to be open minded to cope with everyday challenges and life changes.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
“Time is Gold, don’t waste it” said Rosalia Q.. She is an industrious housewife of Johnny and they are living in Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. They are blessed with a child, John Carlo, he is already 13 years old and he is now a second year high school student. The couple has a great ambition for their son, thus doing their best to give him his desired profession someday. They promise to support him in all his endeavors. 

Her husband is a government employee in their Provincial Capitol of Nueva Vizcaya  while she manages their poultry raising business. She is borrowing additional business capital from KIva lenders amounting to PHP12, 000 as additional capital to her raise poultry and also to support some of their farming needs. Rosalia loves what she is doing in her business and she hopes to improve it for her family especially in sustaining the financial needs of their child in the pursuit of his studies. She hopes also to generate the sympathy of lenders to her current business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun S. is 38 years old and sells parried from her home to earn a living and is able to make US$5 of profit every day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and typically makes about US$5 per day as well. This couple has five children living at home to support.
Bun would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to expand her parried business and make a new investment selling charcaol.

loans.use: To reinvest in her porried business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is divorced and has two adult children that live separately. She sells clothing at the central market in Zaporozhye city. Maria has been in this business for 10 years. During this time she has got two business locations, many repeated clients and large sales experience. Maria enjoys her business and wants to develop it further. Maria would like to borrow 11,300 UAH to purchase fall and winter inventories. This business is the only source of income for Maria.

loans.use: to purchase fall and winter inventories

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Due to difficulties of life, Eduardo A. did not able pursue his studies in college. He helped his father in cultivating their farm lot by plating rice and vegetables after he graduated in high school. At the age of 21 he decided to marry Ludilyn of whom they are gifted with four children. At present, the two eldest is now in their secondary level of education while the two youngest are in their elementary grades. Being a responsible parent, they wanted to give their children a better future by giving them the best education they needed so long as they afford it. 

In this regard, the couple manages to help each other in earning income to support the needs of their children. Eduardo uses his tricycle transport to earn income while his wife engaged in selling food snacks and vegetables in their village. In this connection, Eduardo is asking to borrow loan from KIVA lenders the amount of PHP5, 000 for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle and maintenance of his wife vending business. He hopes that lenders will provide them support that will somehow lead to the progress of their business.

loans.use: additional capital
